The atmosphere is very chill, and relaxing. We talked with some other tourist and had a friendly conversation.  We ordered a fish and chip happy hour snack for $2.99 and was happy with the food quality. Our bartender lady was nice and recommended a great place for Italian food.

I was whisked here right from the airport upon my arrival.  I was tired, hungry, and grouchy and prepared to hate any place that didn't involve sleeping.  I ended up sharing some fantastic potato chip nachos with my friends, and meeting some new friends, too.  Decent beer selection, and I suppose in Vegas it's normal to have so many video poker machines in the bar that you can't set down a drink.

Wow! As always a great time, great food, great staff! We took our son and his girlfriend for dinner, she's never been to an Irish Pub and she loved it. The best nachos we've ever had for an appetizer. How is it that an Irish place can have chips that stand up to all that nacho goodness? Chips were crispy even to the bottom of the plate! Son had fish & chips, girlfriend had steak sandwich, hubby had the breakfast and I had shepherd's pie. Food was great and portions are large, even the half size on the shepherd's pie. Thank goodness for containers to go!  Beer on tap is always a plus. Our waitress was Susan, she's just wonderful!  Kept us happy the entire time. Thank you,  Susan! 
McMullan's is no where near where we live and in 5:30 traffic it took us almost an hour to get there. We'll worth the time!! Go there soon, you won't be sorry.

Oh why do I come here? It's mainly because of their daily specials on drinks, their amazing happy hour and I like to be Iiiirissshhh (pronounced: Arrrrggghhh-rissshh). 
Drinks: depending on which day you go, it's one type of beer and it'll be $4 pint, all day.

Food: Happy hour starts 10 pm - 3 am? Or was it 11 pm - 3 am? Also something like 6 pm - 8 pm? Sorry I can't remember what time their happy hour is. It just happens that every time I go, it's happy hour! Anyways, it's half off for HH. Do get the fish and chips, nachos (with or without meat), and chicken wings.

Service: Eh, depending on whom your bartender/server is. It's a hit or miss. Sometimes they're your BFF, sometimes they're your ugly fat neighbor that hates your cat.
Good old Irish pub. Always open 24/7! Great food, great pub! No sprinkles... just Irish awesomeness! Stay at the Orleans and walk across the street.
Its a cool place just to hang out especially on Tues for the trivia. Get your group and join the Trivia game.

Best pub in town bar none. Friendly bartenders, amazing happy hour and drink specials. Their players club is super as well. 

My go-to when I want a quick bite or cold beer. Their food selection is fantastic. I've had just about everything on the menu and not a bad meal yet!

We went here today because my husband is still searching for the best fish and chips in Vegas.  We ordered the homemade potato chips for an appetizer and they were oh so very good! I had the shepard's pie, and was very pleased with my choice.  The portion was huge and once again I ate way too much.  My daughter had the mac 'n cheese and ate everything we put on her plate, which rarely happens.  So, it's safe to assume that the mac 'n cheese is good too.  And finally- the fish and chips.  My husband reports that the fish is absolutely delicious but the batter needs a little something more.  All in all, he liked it alot, but it still searching for something even better.

The one downer- The service was awful! Our waiter rarely checked on us and when he asked us if we wanted refills, it was about 20 minutes before we got our drinks.  My husband had to eat most of his meal without a drink. :(   

We will definitely be back to McMullan's, with the hopes of getting a different server...
Mediocre food and service.  Moderate sized private room available for meetings and parties.  Bartenders make a pretty good drink.  Nachos are huge.
Standard Bar and Grill happy hour nachos were decent the mini with huge also had the lamb stew broth was very well seasoned but service lacked and the price was steep.

Trivia on a Tuesday night is a fun time.  Some people take it pretty seriously, which makes it all the more amusing.  They have a round where you have to guess the song from a snippet that the host, Dallas, plays.  It's fun when he gives the answers and plays the song.  Everyone in the bar sings along.  

The burgers are ok here but the french fries are pretty good.  The chips with the curry sauce were pretty tasty.  My husband liked the fish and chips and my friend liked the mushroom and steak pie.  The sticky toffee pudding with vanilla ice cream is to die for.  I could eat that all day. Good selection of beer and nice servers.  Free wifi - but don't be using it during trivia!  Definitely a fan.

It been years but use too be regular regular HH at McMullan back in the days (before the smoking law hence the renovation so now inside wall separate smoking section). Loved it! Unlike most bars always find machine on the bar here at McMullan whole area not single machine!! The bar area really nice, they have little cubby hole area at one end of the bar (so can have your own mini party area of sorts), and interior designs with all the little decor spills Irish. They opened up the non smoking side of the bar with since last visit with more bigger tables and even table with pour your own beer from the tap (the prices have no idea; believe it goes by the volume you purchase). I believe on the weekends they play live music on the little stage set up inside and still have trivia night on tuesday believe. The Guinness!!!!!!!! Nothing better in life then drinking Guinness in Irish Pub. But even better is one that done RIGHT taking the time let the beer settle then top off the pint for perfect Guinness. They even till you that up front so if running pinch late that GREAT thing. The vive from moment step in is Irish form the decor, obviously most patrons throwing back Guinness, Harps, or maybe some black and tans, the music play inside, and the food. 

The food interesting being years since last visit but yet HH menu still exactly the same. Great thing. I have always been fan of the nachos! Kettle chips Brilliant! When you get too the bottom of the mound nice know that not soggy enough chip hold all the good stuff on top. It mound even half size is lot of food. The sausage rolls best part is the dough on the outside nice hot and moist. The mustard dipping sauce perfect compliment. The fish and chips some of the best fish and chips I had in town. Everything is reasonable price too! HH is awesome!

The only thing that conscious of if Wranglers game night. It can get packed before and after the game. Thankfully some of iceacholics family day drinking (HH) so beat the crowd could enjoy the company. It gets packed the place tends too get loud and since small place gets nuts. Miss my McMullans think need go back more often especially if on Guinness binge. Lol!!!!

i love irish beer. i made the mistake of asking if the bartender was from new castle because of his accent. no hes irish... he said he hopes i choke on my smithwicks. he was just joking though. always a good place to grab some drinks. guinness, kilkenny, murphys, smithwicks, all good stuff.

Went on St Pattys day this year and was extremely disappointed with the service level and the wait. First we checked in but they wouldn't take our phone number. We would check back after an hour and be told 2-3 more hours. After 3 hrs we went back up to see where we were the guy was very unprofessional started flipping through book and was like your not on this page 4 more hours. Like wtf? They are an Irish pub. Yes they probably make a lot of money that night. They could have made more if they were setting limits to tables for food. People literally were just chilling at tables after eating for hours. That should have been planned a lot better. People drinking want food. We couldn't get food at all. We tried to order the food to go so we could eat where the music was, but after we asked the waitress to order she didn't come back. We waited 20 mins. Food is normally super good so we were all disappointed we had to go across street to eat.

Service was excellent and the food was amazing. My husband and I both got corned beef (he got corned beef & cabbage and I got the corned beef sandwich), and it was delicious! Quite possibly the best corned beef I've ever had! I also had 2 drinks, the "Dark 'n' Fluffy" and the "Whipped Orange", both of which were really good! Glad we found this place before we left Las Vegas!
If you want to get away from the typical greasy bar food, try the Curry Chicken Pot Pie. Excelent!!
Stopped in to visit.  Loved the atmosphere!  Ordered medium Irish nachos and they were amazing!  Three of us shared and barely finished them.  Will definitely be back!

After a grueling 3-hour shopping excursion, my friend and I (along with my battered self esteem) decided to wash away our shopping disappointments at McMullan's Irish Pub.

I have driven past McMullan's a million times but never so much as made it in to the parking lot.  Embracing my Irishness and taking in to consideration few know how to drink like the Irish, what better choice than to drown sorrows at an Irish pub!

With that being said, we walked in to McMullans where the Irish theme and culture were richly represented.  Great band, lots of laughter, beers on special and the potato soup was worth the trip all in itself.

If you are looking for a cozy eatery and watering hole and you're in the area, I would highly recommend this establishment. It's a little noisy for a date, perfect if you've been dating for a while and lost the interest in actually hearing what your other half has to say ;)

We happend upon this place while we were in Vegas to exhibit at an industry trade-show.  While we were out running errands at Home Depot we decided to get a bit to eat and walked into this nearly empty pub in the middle of the afternoon.  The Irish Nachos were AWESOME.  They were a special at the time of day we visited and came in three sizes.  I ordered the medium size after asking the server what the difference was and he gave an indication of the plate sizes, but failed to mention they would be piled about 8" high.  Seriously, the smaller size (I think it was a "light" portion would've fed three people easily.  I'm a pretty good eater and I don't think I got 1/3 of the way through the regular order even with two other people helping a bit.  We ordered the same item at a pub on Fremont the next night at the same price it was about 1/4 the size and didn't have nearly the amount of toppings.

I went in for lunch and was the only patron in the place when I walked in.
It was just me so I sat at the bar.
I didn't see a soul for a few minutes.

Finally, the bartender and another employee (manager maybe, Irish accent) both materialize.
The bartender asking what I'm drinking (I'm trying to see the taps) and I ask for a menu and say i'm there for lunch.
He tells me his beer list is on the 2nd to the last page, then he walks away.
I see what I want and stop him and tell him I'll take a pint of Harp, as he's trying to walk away.
He pours my Harp and disappears.

Now, I have been a bartender, and I know there is prep work that needs to be done, but this guy just walks away into a back room and I don't see him for large blocks of time.

Then he walks out and heads out from behind the bar into a little room where the manager (other employee) was. My menu was down the whole time, I am looking at him the whole time to come take my order. He comes back to the bar and back to the back room without a glance in my direction.

After another in and out of the back room, I order from 10+ft away.

Hey! I'll take the shepherds pie.
He asks a few follow-up questions and my order is whisked off to the back room.

(The 5star part) Within a VERY short time, my food is in front of me.
And it's a very good shepherds pie! 

He does ask me quite a bit in how everything was going, I had a mouth full of food and nodded.

Then he's gone again....

Manager (employee gent) passes by and askes if I need anything.
I ask for my tab, (because I haven't seen the bartender in a while..)
When he prints my tab, the bartender re-materializes for a brief moment, then poof is gone again. 

I waiting a few minutes, so I could pay the bartender, I loathe leaving money on the bar.
I finished my beer, still no bartender, so I leave my $18.99 tab and a twenty under my glass.
I usually over tip. For that tab, I would usually leave $5 (that's over 20%). Not today.

For your inability to do the dictionary definition of Bartender (To tend the Bar)
You get $1.01 and that's because I needed to leave and get back to work and didn't want to wait for my change.

P.S. I will say as I was there more people came in for lunch and the waitress, seemed like she was on the ball, if I go back for lunch, I'll be taking a table!
Awesome! Walking into this place I knew I would like it! Didn't know I would love it ! The Irish nachos are to die for! Also they have Kilkenny on tap!!!

Come here, but not on St. Patrick's day. $20 to get in- even if you aren't going to the concert in the back? That's insane!! But I enjoyed the corned beef and cabbage and the fries I stole off of my sister's plate. I love the irish decor- especially the flags. And one of the waiter's recommended something called a Black Lion or something. It's a beer, but I really did forget the name.
Try the Beer Samplers and the Shepherd's Pie. Oh..and all their desserts are good.

This bar wins my heart with good Irish music and Smithwicks on tap!
My two favorite bar food items: chicken tenders and nachos. Both of which are excellent choices here. When ordering the nacho plate, just know that the small order will feed 2 - 3 people alone. 
Along with everything else, the smoking room is sectioned off so it doesn't interfere with the entire bar - LOVE this!

Great pub.... I've been to Ireland many times and I felt right back in Galway. Scotch egg was great, Shepard pie was perfect and the Guinness and Irish coffee hit the spot.... fish and chips where the best I've had in the states. Highly recommend this place and I will become a regular

I absolutely love this place! I am addicted to the blackened chicken Irish nachos and the Fish N Chips! I would go everyday if my husband would let me. I always say every time i go I'm going to try something new, but i can't! I got my meal free for my birthday with their rewards system! Their awesome!
The breakfast was excellent. I love the taste of their potatoes along with the omelet. Very friendly service as well.
The chips are awesome - order the chips! ORDER THE CHIPS!
This is the best corned beef and cabbage I have ever had! .  Service is a bit slow during happy hour, so remember that,  but a great place to try.

This place has all the staple workings of a great Irish Pub. Irish accent servers and staff. Soccer on TV, memorabilia of all things Ireland on the walls. Darker inside, game room, bar seating, tables abound. May feel a bit cramped when busy but good if not. Big menu of Irish pub staples and many other pub staples as well. Good prices, good qauality and nice portions. Burgers here arw money! And the sweet fry side option alwayd wins me over as well! Solid spot for good Irish eats in Vegas! The GM there is a cool cat! Son of the owners.

I really like McMullan's Irish Pub.  The owner is actually Irish and it is not some chain bar, which I appreciate.  They are very open to working with charity groups to benefit their causes and the decor is excellent and authentic.  My boyfriend wanted me to give McMullan's 5 stars because he absolutely adores the food, but I had some so-so curry their once and it can be a bit pricey, but this is Vegas and I suppose that everywhere is like that... you always meet great people at this bar and it is a festive place to hang out with old friends and new.  On Sundays they have live Irish music and it's cool :)

I had only been here one other time about a year ago and completely forgot how amazing the food is here. Honestly I'm not big on sausage - it's not one of my favorites - but this place just makes it work.

We ordered the Irish Sausage Rolls for $9 as an appetizer and the portion was the perfect size for two people. I'm not sure what exactly is in this dish but I'm not complaining. Sausage in a "puff pastry" and they weren't joking - the pastry that this is wrapped has the perfect amount of fluff and flakiness to it. It comes with Irish stone ground mustard that I would eat with ANY meal. This dish was so easy to get addicted to.

As my entree I got the Aztec burger (8oz ground top sirloin, jalapenos, jack pepper cheese, lettuce, tomato, sliced dill pickles, raw red onions & 1000 island dressing served on a bun - $11). The burger itself was amazing and I would order it again and again but when it comes time to eat it, it's so big that it fell apart within minutes of taking the first bite. I guess that's a good burger though right? The ingredients blended perfectly; it was one of the few times that I didn't feel the need to add spice to my meal. This place is great and the waitress that served us was very nice and patient in explaining the menu to us.

Also - one last thing - the inside is usually packed and STUPID loud so I recommend sitting on the patio if it's not too hot outside (we went at 9:30 p.m.), OH! And there's a Summer drink/food menu  :)

I love McMullan's! The food is exquisite and the service is terrific. The fish and chips were terrific, the Irish nachos are terrific, the pig in a blanket-esque (sorry for the life of me I can't remember the name of this appetizer) was absolutely incredible. I would recommend a night when John Windsor is playing! I absolutely LOVE THIS PLACE!

Pay a lot. Hope you love spicy food!

Went here for wings and fish and chips. The fish and chips are a whopping $15 but bizarre enough the wings ONLY come in an extra hot sauce.
Why!?

I left and didn't get either. Some people are physically unable to tolerate super spicy foods.

Get a clue guys!

this is the first time I've been in an Irish pub or have had Irish food...and i absolutely love it..we weren't planning on having dinner here..we just saw that there was not wait for a table...so we stepped in....i'm not a huge beer drinker but my sisters are..and they loved it...our waiter even had a thick irish accent..so freaking adorable...but the food was absolutely fabulous...i had the braised beef and my sisters had the pork tenderloin....we basically licked the plate...this will definitely be one of the "have to go to" places in vegas

I've been here a couple times in groups and I've never been really impressed.  The way the interior is set up is odd; I don't like where the bands have to set up and feel far too close when they're playing.  Service can be slow.

There's just nothing fun or authentic about it.  It's like someone got their own 'Grow Your Own Pub!' kit, planted a few seeds, sang it some U2 and sprinkled it with Guinness and - lo and behold! - out grew a generic Irish pub!

Additional star for, despite all this, being a fun place to do the Great Guinness toast although I'm sure it could have been more fun in another venue.

Last weekend my husband and I held our wedding reception in the private Shenanigans room at the pub after we got married at The Little Church of The West. Brian McMullan was great to work with leading up to the wedding and let us set up the room with our decorations the day before and store our cake and cupcakes in the refrigerator. We chose  buffet style for our guests and family who devoured the amazing sausage rolls, salad, fish and chips, chicken Florentine, mashed potatoes, and veggies. It was one of the best meals I've had, which is nice to say on my wedding day. The bartender and wait staff were great and very attentive to everyone and even turned the air on for me when I was overheating in my wedding dress. They made the whole evening a success and even though I pushed their limits by having a full seated party of 70, they did everything they could to accommodate my guests. I would highly recommend this restaurant for parties and for everyday meals. It's not just a meal, it's an experience and they sure know how to make you feel welcome! ~ The Murphys

I compare every bar to this place, so that should tell you what I think of it.

"What'll'ya-be-havin'-yuh?" - the loveliest of Irish lilts beckons from the other side of the bar...

This place just has this amazing cozy feel. The food is so well-prepared - the beer battered onion rings are AMAZING! The very best in town.

The bartenders are great & many have been there since I first came here in 2010 - so that should tell you how they enjoy working here, or at least so it seems! Dallas can literally make you anything & then school you on it. He will have you drinking vintage cucumber gin whatevers & 12 year aged whisky & stumbling out with a newfound interest in peaty scotch, lol.

Of course this place gets packed for events, games, and for good reason. But sometimes, you can hide in a little corner & just enjoy quietly.

Sometimes, they even have Irish step dancing.

There is just a touch of charm to this place that only the Irish could foster.

Needed a place to watch some soccer and Crown & Anchor had already annoyed me in that respect.  I cantacted MIP and they said they would definately be playing the game I wanted to see.  

Showed up with a friend and were sent to the back where the game was showing.  Was happy to have it on but could have done without being relegated to the smoking area, but it is a bar ... so I sucked up.

We both ordered food - good, good stuff.  I had a blackened burger with chips and we ordered some of that onion gravy on the side - also good stuff.  I forget what he had but he liked it.

I tried whiskey for the first time - forget what it was called but it was Jamisons and ginger ale ... a Ginger Something or other.  May be my new favorite drink. 

Anyway - thanks McMullans - I will be back :)

I'm in town for CES and watered to find a local spot to watch come football, McMullans was exactly what I was looking for. Great food ( I recommend the shepherds pie), really good service, and laidback atmosphere. There are plenty of places on the strip if you want glitz and glammed, but if you are looking for that neighborhood bar vibe, this place is for you.

This is a review of the food.  Went there for lunch so I couldn't drink beer :(.  I had the fish and chips.  The place is really dark inside.  I have an affinity to Irish pub's because of my love of Irish beer and this is the darkest one I've ever been to. They do have beer specials for every day of the week but none of the days include Guinness.  Old Murphy's and Harp was on there.  The others were non-Irish beers.    Back to the food.  The fish was slightly overcooked and not very well seasoned.  I wasn't a huge fan of the breading.  The fries were slightly over cooked and over seasoned.  My friend had the shepherds pie and he liked it a lot.  I will have to return when I can have a drink, but I think I'll pass on the food.

Hidden away among a convenience store and across the bawdy lights of the Orleans, comes McMullan's pub. The competition to lure would be patrons with guinness and irish shanties are strong in Vegas, and there are a sea of choices to choose. However, I will attest that McMullans should be given a shot, two or 3 of Jamesons in your go to places:

1) wide variety of food options. Different burger styles, curry pies, irish nachos, and of course the fish and chips. They have appetitizer options during happy hour but the bang for your buck is getting the irish nachos half size.

2) John Windsor, the guitar maestro that will seduce your ears with grand ol songs about love, life, whiskey, and beer.

3) McMullans have a shuttle service during Knights game day with limited seating. Call for details on price and all.

So do yourself a favor, grab a pint or seven and sing along the locals at McMullans.

Worst place and service EVER,So bad I just started a yelp account. Servers walked by over and over with no one ever coming over....finally found I think a manager grumpy,unfriendly, Irish man to ask for a server and he walked and said maybe 3 words so fast and without concern,WE LEFT!!!!!Time to hire friendly efficient STAFF!!!!
We had the Irish nachos, some cheap shots, and some decent beer.  All in all a good experience, but the place could use a more varied beer selection.

I will give this place 5 stars, reason being is the owner contacted me to correct my mistake post. I did on the wrong Resturant. I appreciate owners that follow up
On comments or customer experience. I do frequent vegas every couple months and I will  come here to eat, once again thank you for being understanding of my mistake. look forward to trying the Resturant out.

THIS PLACE SUCKS!
As I sit here at McMullan's all I can write for this review is HOW DISAPPOINTING this visit was. The server was confused most of the time and messed up our order. She fixed it but what made me upset was the fact we ordered half order of the Irish Nachos she came back and said she put our order in for a mini and if that was okay.... REALLY? I ordered half bring me what I ordered! For some reason she felt like she could not fix it. Well anyway she fixed it.  As for my chopped salad it was soggy and gross and the blue cheese dressing was salty and nasty. The servers excuse as to why she was messing up "people called out sick" Well that is not my problem, maybe management needs to be improved. Last visit here. DO NOT EAT HERE AND WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY.

This review is for the Tuesday Night Trivia experience.

I've been to this event about 20 times now, and lately the experience has gone downhill exponentially.  Two weeks ago, we had a group of 7 people. Everyone knows that you need a sacrificial lamb or two to go early (around 6 - 6:30) to get a table so that you're set by the time everyone arrives for trivia at 8pm.  (Or later, if your friends are anything like mine)  Well I was the lamb, as usual, and though there were 3 of us by the time 7pm rolled around, we were still admonished by our British waiter that we can't hold a table for 6-8 people if we only have 3 people.  I told him, "We will have 6 or 7."  He continued on about how it wasn't right, so I said, "What about that guy over there, he's only got one person!"  The waiter replied, "Well he will have more people come later."  Yeah, I told him, SO WILL WE.  So annoying.  (Spoiler alert:  by the end of the night, we had 7 people, and the other dude only had one other person join him.  SMH.)  If only admonishing us was the last of the shitty service, but alas, it wasn't.  We were treated poorly for not ordering enough alcohol, daring to ask for refills of coffee or water, and for the audacity to ask for separate checks.  No one thing was that egregious (other than the unnecessary scolding) but the cumulative effect was almost enough to make me never want to return.  Yet return I did the following week, but I asked to sit in another section.

Last week seemed so much more promising.  I sat on the other side, asked for a table for 5 and commenced waiting for the rest of my party..... they were all especially late, much to my waitress' chagrin.  And, unbeknownst to me (and the McMullan's staff), the entire room I was in began to fill up due to an impromptu memorial for some dead guy.  I began to get nervous because all these people were filling up a room beyond capacity and leaving no room for my teammates (when they finally did arrive).  One mourner saw my distress and assured me they would be leaving before trivia.  I didn't believe him, though, because some of his other compatriots were just ordering food and it was nearly 7:45pm.  Sure enough, by the time trivia started, I couldn't hear a word they said over the loud speaker, and none of the mourners were upset enough to keep quiet despite multiple people yelling, "SHHHHH!!!!"   Some people playing trivia up and left, so my party moved over to their table where it was just slightly quieter.  I was beyond disgruntled (especially because our order of Irish Nachos still hadn't come out of the kitchen 45 minutes later).  By the end of the night, we heard most of the questions, but ended up in 11th place.  If we were in contention, I would have been livid because the mourners had formed their own team of 17 people (though 8 is the max), and they won first place, despite having cell phones out and running between rooms sharing answers with other people.  It's hard to take a bar trivia seriously when everyone talks and cheats.  What's the point?  It surely isn't fun because it was anything but....  McMullan's should really police room capacity and trivia cheating.  Until then, I won't be returning.
Love those Irish nachos! Decent selection of beer and good food!

From 9/26/15

We came here for a bite to eat and drinks because you just can't go wrong with pub food! There are two sections to Mcmullan's the bar side and the dining area, so it might be confusing at first when you walk through the front which is on W Tropicana Ave. 

Once we were seated and had a friendly server who was very quick and attentive. We looked through the menu that had a multitude of options to choose from, a good selection of beers, plus decent wine list. I decided on the Three Cheese Burger Wrap, which is on a whole wheat with mozzarella provolone, and mixed cheese and my boyfriend got the Sheppard's pie.

Everything was delicious,  cooked well, and seasoned thoroughly. I really like this place and will have to come back and try everything else.

This place makes the best Irish food I've ever had, seriously. My husband and I split the meat pasty with a side of mash and peas, and the happy hour portion of their nachos. The gravy is seriously amazing and the meat pasty was perfect. Definitely reminded me of my Omas cooking. Also I'm not much of a nacho person but these are to die for. Just try them. We got the half size and it was huge. My husband can eat 3 triples at in n out and even he was full. We still had half of our food leftover. Just eat here, rant over.

My boyfriend traveled through Ireland and has been searching for an Irish pub with authentic food in Vegas ever since. Well, this place is his winner. I think he would sleep here if he could. Irish breakfast is delicious! Curry pot pie was great! Lots of beer selections and the live music creates a great atmosphere. The decor is a little dated, but I dont mind it at all. Sure makes me feel like im in Ireland, not Vegas!

I have to admit that my boyfriend and I will drive all the way across town just to go to McMullan's. I love their fish and chips and their Sunday roast.

The best day for Fish and Chips - Thursday. It's all you can eat and believe me, I can eat. The fish is flaky, buttery and melts in your mouth. The batter is crispy and not too greasy (it should have some grease, it IS fried.) Paired with a pint of Boddingtons and I am in heaven.

For the weekend trips it's always Sunday Roast. Nothing beats savory roast beef covered in gravy served with perfectly roasted potatoes and fluffy Yorkshire pudding. In fact, most of the time I ask if they can forgo the veggies and give me extra pudd. So good with gravy poured inside. I have never tried the pork but my my mom has gotten the lamb and she says it is fantastic also.

As for desserts, try the sticky toffee pudding. The bread pudding was also very good. I so badly want to try other things on their menu (shepherd's pie, bangers and mash, Irish pie) but I am just hooked on their Fish and Chips!

Just wanted to leave another review for this place.  I am never disappointed !    Such good food!!!!!! Tonight we had the bangers and mash, and fish and chips.   I am beyond happy!  So delicious !  Best happy hour and food in Vegas by far and I've lived here nearly 3 years.

Great place for food and drinks.   They have a good selection of food on the menu and my order was prompt.   I also liked the selection of beers and I did not get a chance to try it today, but they also have a good selection of whiskey.   The best item is their Irish nachos.
The owner is sooo friendly.   Love the free shuttle to the Golden Knights game. The food has been tasty. Service (from the waitresses & waiters) has been hit & miss.    Like the live music.

Alright. 

I've made a commitment to only write reviews after I've visited a spot more than once....UNLESS things are so abhorrent I have to let people know. I've been to Mcmullan's often enough to say I FUCKING LOVE THIS PLACE! 

I'll keep it short and sweet. 
The staff is very friendly and quaint. The food is perfect to cure your munchies. The drinks are perfectly poured. 

What more could you ask for at a place like this?! 

This place is legit! I recommend coming here during happy hour - if you're not a gambler. If you just so happen to be a gambler - well, my friend, you'll be very well taken care of :-) 

The burgers are juicy & flavorful. 
The nachos - PLEASE don't skip the nachos!!! Make sure to ask for their special hot sauce - Pepperoux's.
Everything is decently priced ESPECIALLY during HH. 

That is all! I wish wonderful times to those who decide to frequent this place, as I have...and I plan on becoming an actual regular! 

SLAINTE!!

Went to this place today because I heard the Irish Breakfasts were out of this world and I wanted to introduce my friend to something new. I've been to Ireland before  so I was excited to see if the food was made the same. Breakfast stops at 11 am here so we hauled tail to make sure we got there on time. Walked in at about 10:48 am and what do I see....Nobody. Not a single soul or staff member was there to greet and seat us. Now I know mornings are usually slow so staff can be light and that's fine with me, but I waited and waited and waited some more but in the end, nobody came. I must have waited for 10-15 min and nobody came so I left. I was excited to get me some good Irish food too but unfortunately left disappointed. One star for the lack of customer service but I call it like I see it so they get an extra star just because the decor was just like in Dublin.

Spent an evening or two there.  Started out with clamorous rugby loving fans (gal I was with was from Canada and knew everything about the game which was good because I didn't) Then an Irish Folk band sang lyrical tunes which sometimes ended in a whispering of " and f@#xk the British Army!" Ending on the patio with a pretty famous singer who was accompanied by a Bluegrass group which was astonishing because they just threw the act together on the spot.

Review #100!  Woot!

Did my homework before I hit town so I knew this was my place. 

McMullen's has an extensive selection of whisky and Scotch.  For example, they stock three different ages of Redbreast, a highly regarded pure pot still whisky.  A glass of the smooth as silk15 year old type will set you back $16.  A glass of the venerable 21 year old stuff is $41.  On my first visit, I enjoyed the fifteen year old variety.  Sooooo smooth. So delicious. 

As I settled my tab Monday night, the bartender explained that they feature a different whisky every month for a discounted price. Armed with this information, I returned last night to try this month's special,  the highly regarded John Powers Gold Label.  Absolutely delightful.  

Happy Hour here is a chance to try their aps at half price. Monday I tried their crisps with curry sauce. Damn!  Those crisps are good.  Last night I tried the Irish nachos.  They're also delicious, but I liked the plain crisps better.  IMO, they don't really need cheese and sour cream and onions. The crisps are already perfect without all the toppings.   

There's a regular bar and a video poker bar. I played a couple hours on the machine so my John Powers Gold Label was comped.  I went home extra happy. 

Mikey C says: Show me the way to the next whiskey bar...

We met my cousin and her husband here for lunch one day during our vacation.  It so happened to actually be my wife's birthday, but more on that later.  The place doesn't look like much from the outside, but when you walk in, it is a full blown Irish style pub in every accent and detail.   We sat down in the bar and ordered the beer of the day.  When my cousin arrived they ordered Irish coffees, which we tried and were delicious!   

Food wise, I ordered the lunch size shepherds pie, which was still pretty large and very filling-my cousin's husband got the full size and couldn't finish!  My wife got the small size of the Irish nachos with corned beef which was a massive mountain of potato chips cheese, corned beef and other deliciousness.   This place is easily one of my favorite Irish pubs I have been to.  

Service was great and at the end my cousin let it out that it was my wife's birthday, so the server brought this delicious and ridiculously dense chocolate cake out for her, on the house.  We all took a couple bites but had to throw in the towel before it was finished.  Definitely and awesome place!

Fantastic!  Food and service was excellent. Chef Ivan's Florentine was spectacular !  Irish pie with steak was great as well. The shepherds pie was our least favorite, just a little bland.  So glad we stopped here for beer and a bite.  Can't wait to return.

Atmosphere wise this place is perfect, the ideal pub. Music and feel is very authentic, but if you're coming for breakfast...I would pass. The food just isn't that remarkable for breakfast, but based off of other reviews I feel that appetizers and dinner is where it's at. I had the corn beef hash, and it just wasn't all that great. Service was exceptional, so kudos to Chris! Based off of breakfast, this is my review.

Found this place after getting tiured off all the bad Casino food on the strip. It is awesome. Locally owned, and live music and a lively place. Big portions, great chicken, will be back next time I am in Vegas!
Great food, great service and the decor transports you all the way to Ireland. What more can you ask for? Get the fish and chips, you'll thank me.

Pissed I have to give it one star!  Let me preface this review by saying that I did not eat here.  I did not eat here because upon arrival, the host (who wasn't at the stand when we came in, but had to wait several minutes for him to appear) just walked up and said flatly, "There's no room here. We're full."  My mother, sister and I (all well dressed and very presentable) stared at him in shock at his rudeness, and he said, "We have trivia tonight and there's a soccer game."  The place was indeed very full, and we had come hoping to play the trivia (and were about 20 minutes early for trivia), but there are better ways to handle this, such as merely being nice to potential customers.  Needless to say, this was a total turnoff to ever try coming back to this place.

You are not going to get a traditional Irish pub in Vegas, it's just not going to happen. That would be like saying that the Venetian makes you feel just like you are floating down a canal in Italy or that the New York New York is The Big Apple of your eye. Hell, if this were true we could all just flock to Vegas and come home saying we traveled the world...and save a lot on airfare in the process. No, this is not a possibility. 

What you get in Vegas are suggestions and small glimpses of places that actually exist, done up in bright lights with a dash of tacky and a facade of what the real thing might slightly resemble. 

The farther away from the strip that you get, the less inherent these qualities are, so, since it is a bit out of the way, McMullan's is not a bad rendition of an Irish Pub. They pour a good Guinness, are one of the few places that carries Magners in Vegas, and many of their menu items are traditional pub fare. They, however, seem to be, like many establishments in Vegas, trying too hard and overdoing it a bit. 

Nice switch from the glitter and glam of the strip, priced more local friendly, and a variety of bands most every night of the week. Not a bad place, but if you want a true Irish pub Ireland would be a good place to look.

Enjoyed the Farmhouse Irish Breakfast which consisted of eggs, sausage, Irish bacon, baked beans, grilled tomato, and breakfast potatoes. Delicious food and the coffee was delicious. The server was very friendly and worked her b*** off. Unfortunately she was the only one serving so if we needed anything we had to wait a bit. It also took a while before the cooks prepared our food. 

I didn't give it 5 stars because the service wasn't the best and because the restroom needed much attention. The paper towels were overflowing the trash can :/ 

The food was delicious but expect slow service in the mornings and not so clean restrooms. 

UPDATE: Visited the restaurant a second time and the food was delicious, once again but this time the service was outstanding. This is a nice hidden gem in Las Vegas! By the way, this place is open 24/7!

What a cute and fun place! Reminds me so much of an authentic little pub in Ireland. The tables are small and give you such a homey feel. It's a great atmosphere!

The food is so delicious! We ordered a half portion of the Irish nachos...great for 5-7 people. The large would seriously need to be a party of 8 or more. The mini would be perfect for 3-5 people! I would recommend getting extra bacon on them or one the meats to give a little more flavor! 

The fish and chips, chicken Florentine, shepherds pie, and steak & mushroom pie are incredible! We had a fairly large party (6 adults and 2 kids) and shared these four entrees. The portions are HUGE and are well worth it! We even had leftovers!

The servers are kind and helpful. The service itself is on the slower side. We waited a long time for our drinks, appetizer, food, and dessert. It wasn't super busy when we got there and ended up being there for about 2 hours. It's a slow experience, which might be a good thing since the food is so good and heavy.

For dessert, we had the sticky toffee pudding and chocolate cake! Both are absolutely wonderful!

Fantastic food! I look forward to hitting this place up every time I'm in town. There was live entertainment which was pretty good, and we were kindly seated in a side room where it was slightly less loud so we could even enjoy it! ;) Seriously, go there and order some of the Irish foods; you won't be disappointed. We were told to get the Irish Nachos which we didn't do (it was late), but I'm told it's integral to the experience, so I guess I'll have to do that next time.

The food is amazing!  I have never been disappointed with anything I've ordered.  The service on the other hand is not so great.  This is not the place for "quick" bite as we're usually there at least an hour because of service. I've only been at dinner time, though, so it may be quicker for lunch.  9 times out of 10 they're not very friendly either. Seem to have more fun with each other than bothering with the patrons.  John 
Windsor is hilarious and talented, though so I would definitely recommend this place on a weekend. Darby O'Gill  & the Little People plays there often and they are a lot of fun, too! The food and entertainment definitely make up where the service is lacking.

Went here last week before a Wranglers game because it's so close to the arena and because fellow Yelpers gave it high marks.

As usual, the Yelpers were true to their word.

Great Pub!

Low lighting, dark wood, great beer, a boisterous group and lots of memorabilia = a Good Irish ambiance.

What's even better is that there is a Smoking side and a Non-Smoking side. :) 

We started with the Irish Sausage Rolls... YUM!  These are Irish pigs in a blanket and are yummy, yummy!  These and a pint... coulda eaten them all night long.  The sausage was savory and juicy... the blankets were soft and flaky.

I had the Diddy's Irish Stew and my companions ordered the Chicken Causeway Curry.  All of it was FABULOUS!  

My stew was hearty and savory with big chunks of lamb.  The brown bread was perfect for dipping in the stew.  My companions' curry was also very good without being overly-curry-ie.  Theirs was served with Jasmine rice as you might expect a curry might be.  I think the base for the curry was the same as my stew so I think that's why I liked it (as I am not a curry fan).

Service was spot on!

All in All, a GREAT meal that was quick, tasty and filling.  We will definitely be going back to McMullan's before the Wranglers game again.
OH MAN! Returned for the medium Irish Nachos with beef. Sooooo good and sooooo much food: we ate until the button on my jeans flew off and nearly took out the wife's good eye!

My friend who lives in Vegas suggested McMullan's when we picked a date to have drinks and catch up. She arrived a few minutes before I did, so she was at the bar getting a drink. We ended up grabbing one of the large tables in the back room since we were a group of 6 (she had a friend and I brought my Vegas crew). 

Drinks are super affordable and if you're there during happy hour, which we were, appetizers are very cheap too. We got their Irish nachos, which are basically hand-cut potato chips in a mountain of cheese and sour cream. It was really, really good, but such a huge portion we couldn't finish between the 4 of us. 

They also have live music (we were there on a Friday night at about 10:30pm), which was nice. It's a bit far from the Strip, but that just means it's less touristy!

Shepards pie was amazing.  Fish & Chips are pure money and definately start with the warm curry and chips.  Our waitress was Irish which really added to the ambiance.  The only caution I give you is that the Guinness is as close to fresh as I have tasted this side of the Atlantic, and they go down very easy.  A few nights they have live authentic Irish folk music.  We went twice in the 4 days we were in Vegas.

Thanks to Pokemon Go, I've found a hidden gem near me. I've always gone for happy hour and the deals are great, 1/2 off appetizers and $1 off drafts I think. They also have a beer flight for $5. 

Hands down the best lemon pepper wings I've EVER had. Granted, I've only had wings at a few places including Buffalo Wild Wings & wingstop but the wings here come out super hot, crispy on the outside and very well seasoned. Plus, you get 12 wings for about $6-7 during happy hour. But make sure you count your wings because the last two times we went they were 1 or 2 wings short. We didn't catch it the first time until we almost finished the entire plate but notified the server the second time the same thing happened. The server apologized and brought out our missing wings. 

Irish nachos were ok, we ordered the half order. Full order is HUGE. The potato chips were again, very hot and came with a bunch of cheese and sour cream. I wasn't a fan of the cheese but enjoyed the chips. However, I probably won't order them again.

Fish and chips were my sisters favorite but I felt that the fries were inconsistent. Depending on who's cooking, they could be overly salty or soggy. Either way, my sister and her BF enjoyed them. One downside is that they don't give you enough tartar sauce! 

It's pretty dark in there and the crowd can get kind of loud, but what do you expect? I love looking at all the decorations. Service was great and they have good specials on entrees as well.

McMIllan's is one of the best Irish Pubs I have ever been in (well atleast until I finally make it to Ireland then all bets are off). 

The food at McMullans is really really good, I usually opt for the Irish Nachos (homemade potato chips, covered with cheese, bacon, and sour cream) but this time I opted for a full meal. 

Every day from 4-7 they have happy hour which includes $1 off draughts and well drinks as well as a small assortment of apps for $2.99, but I wanted to give the winter menu a try. (I know old review from my blog, I'm moving a bunch of them over here}

There were 3 things I was debating between, The Shepard's Pie, Irish Stew, and Meatloaf, I then noticed they had an Irish sampler that included both the pie and the stew plus corned beef and cabbage so I decided to give it a try.

I was wondering how all 3 would be served, as I didn't want them to mix together or anything, and then they brought it out. It came out on a big plate with each entree in a ramaken and looked amazing. I first had the Corn Beef and Cabbage, I am not a huge fan of this usually, but the beef, carrots, and broth were amazing, I'm not a big fan of cooked cabbage, I had a few pieces it was good, but I didn't finish it all. Next up was the Irish Stew, it had huge chunks of potato, carrot, celery, and beef, if a great brown gravy (hands down my favorite of the night), then it was time for the Shepard's pie, I have had better and worse, it wasn't anything to write home about, but then again I could have been spoiled by the stew (it was that good!!!). 

The meal was also served with some homebaked brown bread, It was a really heavy rye bread but soaked up the gravy and broth perfectly and was a nice addition to the meal. I washed it all down with a Black Velvet (a draught of half Guinness and half cider). All in all a great meal.

Found this place by accident and I'm glad that I did!  Had 2 free nights at the Orleans and the first night that I was there, I was getting ready to take the free shuttle from the hotel over to the Strip.  Looked to the right and saw this place across the street.  I love these 24-hour pubs and taverns in Vegas, so I walked over there and really enjoyed everything about this place.  I didn't eat because I wasn't hungry, so I just had an iced tea and gambled a little at the bar.  2 days later, before driving back to LA, I hung out here for a little over 2 hours and won $95 on their table top slots and video poker.  They do a lot of fun things here.  For example, when someone gets a natural 4 of a kind on one of their video poker slots, they spin a wheel at the bar and that person, or even the other customers can win a prize, depending on what the wheel lands on.  I won a $15 booze voucher, but since I was leaving that night and don't live in Vegas, I gave it to this really cool guy who was sitting next to me at the bar.  I absolutely loved everything about this place!  The bartenders, the customers, the gaming and the atmosphere.  I will definitely come back here my next trip to Vegas, and also have lunch and/or dinner here, as I've heard their food's great as well and I also want to go there on a Tuesday night, since they have trivia every Tuesday night and I love bar trivia!

After a rough night out I went here to chill.  I tend to prefer bars and pubs over clubs and have a much better success rate or just a good time when I'm not on the prowl.  Besides it's open 24 hrs and is off the main drag if you like being away from the crowds.  I highly recommend it!

I love this place. Really. It's a must stop every time I go to Las Vegas. Irish pubs are a dime a dozen, but it's almost impossible to find one that is really authentic. McMullans hits all the right notes, GREAT traditional food, lots of Irish beer on tap (not just Guinness), live music, friendly and sometimes slightly sassy service.  If you've been to Ireland, you will instantly feel like you are back. If you haven't been, this is a wonderful place to get a taste. Based on the accents, most of the employees are from Ireland as well, and only add to the cozy and welcoming feel of the place.

As for food, I've never had anything that wasn't great, but over and over again I find it difficult to order anything other than the Irish farmhouse breakfast. It's simply the best version of Irish breakfast I've had anywhere in the states: real Irish style sausage and bacon, delicious white and black pudding, grilled tomato and amazing brown soda bread. It's heaven. Wash it down with a Kilkenny Cream ale or a Smithwicks and you might as well be in Dingle.

There's also trivia on Tuesday nights which is a ton of fun. I can't recommend this place enough as it's very existence makes me happy.

Holy moly! I love this place. Whether I come in for lunch/ dinner or late night drinks. Always great service. The food is always tasty. I will always love the Irish Nachos! Yum! The potato soup is very good. Very, very good. They have a decent happy hour and a good selection of whiskey and beer. Also, appetizers are half off during happy hour! It's always busy whenever I go, any time of day and I can understand why. They do lots of rad things for the community and I hear they will start having yoga at the pub!

Went for happy hour. Be sure to sit in restaurant area for non smoking which is charming with nooks and cozy areas. Great atmosphere, Waiters and many people who work there are Irish. I had the mussel appetizer for dinner which was excellent, Irish nachos were ordered and enjoyed. The BF had Shepherd's Pie which he enjoyed. Will definitely go back. Fun place good food, large appetizer portions.

McMullen's isn't as authentic as a real Irish pub, but it is close. Also the food is pretty good, on that note I might add that the Irish Nachos are humorous and tasty. Furthermore for Vegas its prices are fairly decent.  The interior of the bar/restaurant is fairly nice, though they did put it on a little thick with quotes from Irish writers. That being said McMullen's isn't half bad and could be considered a diamond in the rough when it comes to Vegas.

Visiting from Sedona Az. Ordered the Irish Coffee because it was highly recommended. It was good but not earth shattering fabulous, as it was described.  The basic cheeseburger was excellent. Cooked exactly as I ordered. Excellent!

McMullan's has amazing food, foreign beers, live music, and trivia nights. It would be cool enough just for that but it also feels like a wooden labyrinth with multiple bars and nooks. Oh and the coolest part? It has a patio. It may not be used much in the hot summer but it's great any other time of the year or late at night. 

McMullan's is a pretty big property, so most of the time you don't feel too crowded. It does get rather rowdy during live music on weekends though. This is also a regular hangout for Cirque folk after shows get out. Irish nachos are basically a must have if you want something to share around. The sliders are awesome because you can get three different kinds at once. I love variety. 

I've been to the trivia once and it was easily the best trivia in town. They had a leader board screen and one of the rounds was a name that tune round which was so fun. I don't know if that's a regular thing but it should be. Any time I'm trying to think of a bar near the south Strip to go to that isn't on the Strip I pick this one. It has genuine character, something most Las Vegas bars do not have.

Their food sounds fairly familiar on the menu, but when you taste them, they have a exotic strangeness that I like. For example, I never knew what "Marie Rose Sauce" tasted like until I went there to have some chips, but their Irish Curry tasted like a spicier version of my mom's Asian Curry. It even has the same greenish color too.

Any time after 5pm, at any day, is happy hour here. And that means appetizers are half price and so are some of the selected beers. And these are not small appetizers, a plate of Irish chips is about the size of a meal at a fraction of the price ($4) that I would pay for a Big Mac at McDonalds. Nachos and fries are ridiculously huge on the plate.

You'll find a lot of exotic beers here, with names that you never heard of anywhere else. The folks serving you drinks are bona fide Irish, they talk with a accent thats kind of hard to understand without concentrating. And the drinks have a tendency to creep up on me, it builds up to a drunk feeling that is a lot stronger than what I am used to. 

You can find a legitimate Irish Breakfast here too, with black pudding (blood sausage), eggs, etc. And it barely puts a dent in the bank account, just ten bucks!
Great Irish pub. Celtic music, cool mixologists, good bar food. Perfect St. Paddy's Day hang.

Been here many times and I'll keep coming back because the food and drinks are excellent the staff is great. Easy to get to across from The Orleans so if you're staying there or just want to gamble its convenient. And they have a smoking section.

Love this pub I try to come here when in vegas especially on sudays they got a great live irish folk singer who sings tons of irish songs and many more.  The food was great and this place is great for groups.

Chill atmosphere, good Irish nachos. 

Looks like they deliver some other good eats here, but I didn't stay long enough to find out.

Close to the Orleans, like reallllly close.

Has this off-the-strip authenticity that is a welcome escape from the usual glitz and shine of the other bars in Las Vegas.

And this is what you would call a short review. :)

Me & my co-workers will stop by after work time to time here n have a lunch & drinks n we tip pretty good since we r in the same industry but, we've noticed past couple of times when we had b-day parties they only had 1 bartender that was serving drinks and FOOD at the same time for both bars n we had slowest service ever! It's not her fault cz we saw it's was getting too much for her but, they need to have at least 2 bartenders or bar-back to help her out on the weekends especially if there's any games going on different taps r running...we probably won't come here for any future gathering anymore though...too bad!

Came for breakfast while staying at The Orleans on a Saturday morning around 10:30. Service was quick food was great. Bloody Mary's were delicious. Will be back in the future. Decor was authentic. Looks like the perfect spot for celebrating St. Patty's!

Absolutely love this place for so many reasons. When you come in you just feel welcome. That's partly to do with the excellent staff and partly the warm decor. Don't get me wrong, it's an Irish pub but it feels like home.

I come here every year to take part in StBaldricks and I'm moved every year hearing the story of the owners and why they are so passionate about this cause. Every year the event here is one of the best in the country and that is 100% due to all they put into this place.

On top of that, the food is really good! Had to come back to close my tab and gather my card from last night and figured I would grab some breakfast. Having the Irish farmers breakfast and it's all tasty. Really amazing coffee too.

As with all good Las Vegas bars you should never be judged by your 8pm to 2pm hours...no...you need to know where the real drunks go. The hopeless helpless bastards that stare longingly into drink and remember the better days, the happier times, the girl in Bangcock who did something to their anus they never thought they would like...and now they can't find anyone to do again. So, a few weeks ago while back out west on...um...well...let's call it business...I was in the bar at 4:30am and stated until about noon. The perfect time to be in a great bar. With Mcmullan's it was more of the same...some great...some not so great. Great...the overnight bartenders are way better than the prissy little punks who work during the day...one in particular who worries more about his hair than anything else. Great...the food is excellent for a pub at any time of day or night, and quite frankly...it was better at 5am. Of course I was coming down off of paint fumes, gas fumes, turpentine and a pill someone told me would turn me into a donkey, but all i kept seeing was Buddy Epson everywhere. Strange. Great...amazing soccer matches were on and the fans seemed really fanatical to be there at 5am watching their teams. The bad...the music is horrible beyond horrible. It is a tape, I guess, and it is all bad from start to finish. The Irish are known for bad music...Bono, Riverdancers, Charlotte Church, etc... but this is America...we love good bar music! The bad...they kept fiddling with the lights. We wanted it dark, the bartender wanted it brighter...she won. Well, when she pays for the drinks and the food she can have it anyway she wants. Until then...we pay, she does. Period. The place is still uneven and far from its former glory...but they make money and people are always there...so I guess they figure adequate and decent are good enough...mores the pity.

Friday arrived and we have wanted to try this pub. I myself was born into an Irish American clan so when someone says "Irish food" I know I can at least rely on some beer for flavor and interest. What they say about Irish food is true. Dull.
We sat out on the Cameron Street patio which does have heaters. It was pleasant enough. Our waitress , Susan, was wonderful though everyone noted how overworked and under-helped she was. For some reason I felt as though I was in a dream. Guinness, which I like, was for the first time ever, lifeless and resembled a much lighter substance- water. A second beer of another type had never shaken hands with a single hop. 
The home made potato chips were nice.
The McMullan's meat pasty had flaky crust. Little flavor to the insides.
Chicken curry pie was somewhat flavorful.
Mashed potatoes and peas were ok.
The stools on which we sat outside were wobbly and felt weak as though you had to remain very still. 
For some reason a big a$$ and his loud rowdy attention- seeking wife were just behind us. The man reached over and pulled some hair from the back of my sweater. It was very weird but we were pleasant about this intrusion. Later they tried to engage us in loud conversation unsuccessfully while others on the patio were noting their crass behaviors too.
It would have been preferable to sit inside where we could have been bombarded by the live music, pushed in the ribs by the happy drinking crowd, and avoided these two dopes.
The three stars are for Susan and the other wait staff who remained very pleasant and helpful despite aching feet and backs from working so hard at this place.
I would not return for the food. It was hot when delivered but the next time I want watery beer and something bland to eat I can break apart a shipping box into little bites and dilute my own Guinness. Meh.
We came in for a snack. Ended up having the sausage Rolls, Fish N Chips and more chips with gravy. It was so good. The Irish Coffee is also amazing. Will be back for sure!!

Hands down, my favorite pub in town!

I may not drink alcohol, but I definitely LOVE the food and atmosphere at this place. The happy hour really can't be beat, from 3PM-6PM and 11PM-2AM, with 1/2 priced full-size appetizers. 

I usually order a plate of the Irish Nachos with Blackened Chicken. These nachos are like CRACK. Fried potato crisps covered in cheese, bacon and chicken. Absolutely delicious.

If you're going just for the appetizers, I also recommend the sausage rolls and chicken fingers, both are absolutely delicious!

In addition to the appetizer menu, the items on the regular menu are pretty damn tasty as well. I love the Grilled Blackened Chicken sandwich, which provides a pretty filling meal for $9.

For the most part, the service at this place is pretty good. There are a couple of bartenders that are less talkative than others, but most everyone is rather friendly. 

I recommend avoiding this place on Friday nights, as there is a loud and not particularly great band that plays covers all night (Darby O'Gill and the Little People). Other than that, you're golden!

we stop by at this bar 3 times a week after work for one reason: crack head Jason :) he is our favorite bartender and super funny. He treats every single guest with respect and comps as much as he is allowed. He works weekends late night shift.

The only healthy choice in this pub is salmon meal.. everything else is fish and chips type of food. I would give them another star if they had a big screen, instead, they have bunch of small screen TV which are not the best to watch the game,.

My favorite-every-other-Friday-happy hour-hang out! McMullan's is a great place to have a drink and eat some delicious food. Every server I had, had always been awesome. Can't wait for the next Friday I go again!

McMullan's probably has one of the best happy hours in town. Great prices on the food, and a rotating drink menu make a perfect late night spot.

Like a couple fellow yelpers mentioned, the HH item to order are the nachos. This plate is massive, even the smallest serving, the mini could easily feed 2-3 people. I remember ordering the full order once and pretty much everybody at the place was starting at the foot-high mound of potato chips and cheese. At around 7 bucks, you can't beat it. If your a wing person, try out the 12 wings, each tossed in a different flavor. Lemon-pepper was my favorite.

The rotating beers on tap are a nice touch. Each night they put a special brew up for 4bux. The place can get really noisy and busy on the weekends. Certain night they have bands come in, and if there is soccer on, the place is packed.

This review is for 3.5 stars.

McMullin's is as good as any other Irish bar in the city.  They offer the beers you would expect, in addition to a few more craft varieties.  Their food is average but on par with the rest of the city when it comes to this type of fare.  

The 3.5 stars mainly come from two things: beer deals and trivia.  They have a few deals during the week that bring the price down a few dollars to make the price very affordable compared to other establishments in the area.  Next, their trivia is one of the better ones in the city.  The bar gets packed and it is very competitive.  The questions are not unreasonably hard (other than the music round) but good luck winning unless you're a pro.  There are upwards of 20 teams a week and usually some trivia experts who win every week.  

McMullin's is still fun to come out and play trivia and drink some beer, but the restaurant itself is not a must try on its own.

This is a pub and restaurant. Emphasis on the pub. (More of that later.)

I went specifically for the fish and chips.
It was not Thursday-where they have All You Can Eat Fish and Chips .. But I didn't care. I had a craving and I knew what I wanted , even though they had a steak and shrimp SPECIAL which would have been 11 bucks and the 3 piece Fish and Chips was 16 bucks.
 
Like many pubs the lighting is dim , I couldn't even read the menu. I knew what I wanted so it didn't matter.
(Later my eyes had adjusted from coming in from bright daylight and I could see things better.)
 The fish was excellent . Big tender flakey pieces deep fried in a beer batter . Very satisfying and filling. Next time I will opt for the 2 piece.
Tiny side of slaw was some of the best I've had. I only wish it was a bigger portion.
The heaping pile of fries tasted good to begin but seemed to grow soggy with time.
I'm a vinegar man when it comes to fish and chips and happily they had malt vinegar. I also tried the tartar sauce even though I don't do tartar . It was really good. But I stuck with my vinegar.

The wait staff was very efficient and friendly . Jessica was my server and was very helpful and answered other questions I had about happy hour, portions, other menu options etc.

Here's the thing . It's a pub as I mentioned before. People drink here. People get drunk here.
When I went there was a large very loud table where at least one of their party got borderline belligerent and entertained his table by telling innapropriate and offensive "jokes" the entire time I was there.
NOT the fault of the resturaunt I realize .. I only mention it to illustrate what is likely to be part of the atmosphere in any pub-resturaunt ... So not a good place for kids.

I love love love the nice private booths that may be available depending on how crowded it is. 

I will DEFINATELY come back here, mostly because it is close to my house. But being entirely honest - the food is good. 
Happy hour offers half price appetizers until 6 pm and I was kindly offered happy hour prices even though happy hour had only one minute left when I arrived.
Warning : some of the appetizers are meals unto themselves. For example the Irish Nachos are HUGE.

To make this a better dining experience for me - they would have to put candles on the tables or adjust their lighting .
I realize there's nothing to be done about the noise level of drunks, and that is part of what you bargain for when you eat at a pub . 

P.S ... Some may think 16 bucks is a little steep for fish and chips , but do some price checking at other places . Good resturaunt fish and chips are all gonna be about that price . And these were really good.
2 pieces run around 13 bucks and would be more than filling .
They do take reservations here but unless you request a special booth or back room private areas.... You should be fine with just showing up without reservation.
Delicious Irish nachos and fish and chips. Huge portions and good service. A little dark and one bar area was stinky smoky. Would definitely go again, Yum!!!

We use to come here every night until I moved to Cali. This place was awesome all the old world pub charm lots of people to interact with. The beer oh the beer is supberb I don't know what makes it that way but its a must. The band we use to see was Darby O'Gill and the Little People....

I have been staying at the Orleans when I come to Las Vegas for at least the past eight years. I cannot believe I have never walked over to this place. The waitress, Cassie, was top-notch and went out of her way to take care of us and make sure we were happy with everything. We started with a flight number two of Irish whiskey as recommended by our waitress! Wonderful? I now have a new favorite Irish whiskey,Powers Signature.
My boyfriend and I each had a cup(big as a bowl at other places) of corn chowder. A tiny bit on the salty side but very creamy and corn flavor!
We then split a steak with mashed potatoes and veggies. Tender and cooked to perfection. 
Our friend had Casies favorite, steak and mushroom pie. WOW! Do not miss this disj! Flaky crust, tender steak.
No room for dessert this time but we will be back.
They are
Open 24 hours.

This pub is definitely in my top 3 in this town. There's so much to comment on but I will just include the things that truly made me fall in love with McMullan's.

- $2 chips and gravy during happy hour(regularly $4). The gravy was so good you could drink it right from the bowl. And after several Smithwick's I did just that to prove it.
- Buy one get one free drinks when you show them a Las Vegas Wrangler's ticket stub from that night.
- Amazing beers on tap including the aforementioned Smithwick's, Guinness, Harp, Boddingtons, and a selection of deliciously tart ciders.
- They know how to correctly pour a Guinness!
- The live bands are ALWAYS entertaining and many times very funny!
- There is a special closed off sidebar for smokers so you can actually go to this bar for a few hours and come home without your clothes smelling all nasty

bomb shepherds pie! 
and our server chris was highly attentive, organized & awesome! 
oh and the bloody mary rocked!

I absolutely love going here for trivia night, and would a lot more often if my two most solid teammates hadn't moved away. Sob! But they were back for a visit, so off we went, with a few more characters of questionable worth in tow (they were relatives- what can you do)? Turned out great. We had a large enough party to sit in a private room, and with a small crowd, you can order ALL the appetizers and not look fat! (OK, maybe that part didn't work).

 We got there a couple of hours early so we could take our time eating and drinking, and it worked out fine. Waitress seemed a little moody at first, but cheered up as the evening wore on (didn't we all?) ,so we have no complaints about the service. The food is good, but bear in mind that, being Irish and all, the cuisine is very heavily potato-based. I have no quarrel with that, but food that heavy does sit a little better when the weather is cooler. Might also help not to scarf down quite so much of it, but how can you leave any of those cheese-a-licious Irish nachos on the plate, even when your huge platter of fish and chips is coming and you KNOW you're going to order the sticky toffee pudding? Have another beer - it will be OK.

 Tried the curry flavored pot pie- spicy and delicious, and really liked the turkey burger, topped with (YES!) goat cheese. The homemade potato chip side dish was odd- strange pile of light, crisp fried flaky things. Didn't taste bad, but the texture was dry and more like packing material. Of course, if we hadn't eaten potatoes in 10 other incarnations prior to these, they would not have survived, either. Only loser was the wing appetizer. The parmesan flavor were hot, juicy, and crispy, but a few seconds after the initial bite, you were hit with such an overpowering jolt of salt and sour that each and every mouth puckered into a very convincing sphincter facsimile.

 The Trivia was fun and well-run, as usual, and even the scrubs came through, pulling some correct answers out of god-knows-where! (Ex: during the song identification segment, they played the first few bars of a lot of 60's songs. My 23 year old daughter laughed that they all sounded like "Lollipop" to her. So, on the one we had no clue about, we guessed Lollipop, and OMG it was right)! Proves that it's helpful to bring a variety of folks. You never know what they're going to ask.We finished respectably, probably could have done a little better if we quit fighting over the answers and the last of the whipped cream! Not to mention our star player took the opportunity to hibernate through most of it. Oh well- next time!

One of my fav Irish bars and the food is so good. Irish nachos are delicious and their fish and chips are bomb. Recently had the Irish sliders and scotch egg which were super good. So far they can do no wrong.

Feels like home 
The Guinness is the best you can find!
The service is so welcoming the vibe is fun and chill and the food's awesome too!!!

My fav place for a beer in vegas!

I was told they had incredible nachos and, boy, was I blown away!

Their nachos were unique since they use freshly made potato chips.  The ground beef meat sauce is extremely savory and really makes the entire dish so impressive.  I'm usually not that impressed with nachos, but these are a different story.  I was here with 5 other people and honestly the largest order was enough for all of us as far as a meal...very filling and very satisfying.

Good happy hour specials too!

We loved this place. It was our first night in Las Vegas and we had a great hot meal after our long traveling days. I had the blackened cod fish and my husband had the Shepard's pie with perfect mashed potatoes and veggies and a generous portion. It had a great Irish atmosphere that we loved. We did go back again for the best Irish Coffee and happy hour specials. If we lived nearby this would be a regular stop for us.

Irish Nachos are amazing..... don't do the Corned Beef sandwhich because it's bland as all can be (no cheese, only mustard).

I got the Reuban Sandwhich last time i was there and it was amazing (I'm just not a fan of Rye).

The wife ordered a sierra nevada pale ale, and it was sour and flat.  She also ordered a burger, and the bun was soggy before she got to the second half.  

Love the atmosphere, but the last experience was a bit disappointing for the price I paid.  Regular side of fries with my sandwhich were nothing special.

Yum yum! We came here for good food and were not disappointed. This place is awesome and not too expensive. I got one of their pies and it fed me for 3 meals. I will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas

This visit to Las Vegas was supposed to be for a wedding until the bride and groom decided that they were gonna go there separate ways. The father of the bride was nice enough to rent a huge party limo with doolies and get all of us together for dinner and rented one of the private rooms here at McMullans.  When the limo went of the strip I was a little nervous, and being my first time in an Irish joint, I was really nervous. That feeling didn't last long let me tell you.  The father of the bride Jim stood up proudly, and thanked us for making the trip and joining his family in this tough time. He then showed his appreciation by announcing a full bar and dinner buffet on him.  The bartenders were super friendly and poured a great beer.  They put out some appetizers as we all sat around the round tables sharing our stories of how the bride and groom brought us together.  By the time the dinner bell was rang we were all pretty shit faced.  I couldn't even tell you what all they had to eat.  They did have some off the best fish in chips I've ever had.  It was served with a homemade tarter sauce, fresh lemons and some one at the table turned me on to Malt vinegar for my fries.  The bartenders went above and beyond, clearing plates seconds after my fork hit the middle of the plate as I pushed it away from me.  Drinks were refilled promptly so I didn't even have to get up after I got my buzz.  I would like to personally thank the fine folks of McMullans for putting on great dinner and it was a night we will talk about for years to come.

Great spot to watch World Cup matches. Fun crowd!  Great service!  Good beer!  Terrible food. We realize they are an Irish Pub, but you should be able to cook a burger to order. We both ordered burgers Medium...both were super well done. Very disappointing especially for $13 each.

I went back to McMullan's for their AYCE fish and chips again and was super disappointed.

The fish had a distinctly unappetizing ammonia-like smell. My husband smelled it, I smelled it, and even our waitress smelled it after we pointed it out to her.

A second order was just as bad-smelling. Fish starts to smell like ammonia when it rots and decomposes. Mmm-mmm good.

The one star is for the Irish nachos, which were delicious (we split an order of those instead, after the fish was taken off the bill).

I won't be back.

Its a great late night spot to get good bar food.

I had the Irish nachos with chicken. I live all the toppings but im not sold on the home made chips. The consistency  was off, but in my drunken haze they were yummy.

I have been to this pub many times on my way home and every time I have to say I am disappointed with the service. The bartenders are god awful! It takes forever for them to come around to take your order or refill a drink. Normally they are busy and as someone who works in the hospitality industry I understand. Last time my boyfriend and I came in and the place was completely empty except the sole bartender there. After having to tell him how to make a bay breeze he finally took our order. Food was good and fast ( the reason why they even got 2 stars) but after telling the bartender we were ready for the check and my boyfriend drunk going to the bathroom Comming back and then just went to the car while I waited for another ten mins for the bartender to stop playing with salts. Pretty sure he was hammered. Which must be the case every night because I have not once left there without asking myself if the good food was worth the shitty service. Don't expect much when you come here.

I really wanted to love this place, but who am I kidding? A vegetarian in an Irish pub? It's very unlikely they are going to have vegetarian options, but I tried.
