Best Guinness and Kilkenny in town!!!! Food is always great, service is awesome and always a great spot to catch a soccer game!! We love Dallas and can never get enough of McMullins! Yum! If you're a local or even visiting from out of town don't forget to stop in here for a beer and some tasty food!!

I gained about a thousand pounds after having dinner here but IT WAS WORTH EVERY POUND!

My SO had been raving about their sticky toffee pudding for ages so we finally stopped by when we were in town recently.

Fish & Chips: YUM.
Irish Nachos (half order with ground beef): YUM (too much food even for a table of 5)
Irish breakfast: YUM (not a fan of the black pudding, but I don't like blood sausage in general)
Steak and Mushroom pie: YUM
Sticky toffee pudding: YUM


Service was pleasant and they had some good tunes playing. Would definitely come back in the future!

Definitely one of the best Irish Pubs in Vegas.  It's convenient and has a great location right on Tropicana and Cameron.  I've been here many time for weekends, St Patties Day, Trivia night or just the random lunch.  I bailed on work today and decided to grab some food and beers.  This was a great choice.  I got some beers, a sandwich and I followed that with a shot of Jamo and fish sticks.

Stopped in for lunch and got lucky that we arrived in time for happy hour. Our group had the Irish nachos which were amazing. A lot of food for a really great price. The beer selection was great. Lots of delicious Irish drafts. The entrees were very generous and delicious.  Our server, Blair, was lovely!  She was super efficient, personable and knowledgeable. Great lunch. We will be back!

My family and I have eaten at this pub many times and have had a wonderful time and amazing food.  However, our visit tonight was completely different due to the attitude of a server.  We always come for happy hour because we have three small children and want to avoid the crowds that generally come out later than that.  We were seated and then asked about happy hour items and were told that their crisps were recently taken off happy hour.  No problem, but the waitress went back and forth with us on if we were going to get them three times.  After we got our final no to the crisps and made our order for the sausage rolls she asked if that was all we wanted in a strange fashion as if it almost bothered her that that was all we were going to order and then she hastily ran off when we were still trying to order.  My husband then multiple times tried to get her attention so that we could order, once looking her in the face telling her that we wanted to continue to place our order.  He then got her attention for the last time and she finally came over.  We ordered the Irish stew and yet again she asked if that was all we were going to order.  We order things as we go depending on how we feel, as we do not like to waste food.  There were not that many tables for her to wait on, so I don't understand the constant awkwardness with the question of whether or not we were going to spend more or not.  At this point I told my husband that the situation was getting too awkward for me and that I just wanted to try to come back another day when that waitress would not be there.  My husband then spoke to the bartender/manager about the situation and he said that we could leave if we wanted to, but that he was going to speak with her.  As we were attempting to depart our waitress comes up to us and tries to discuss the situation of her behavior with us and says that she can sit us with another waitress that has just come on.  In all our years of eating out, I have never come across any business that would allow their employees to behave in this manner.  Had the manager come up and offered us a new waitress we may have been willing to stay, but the problem waitress herself coming over to discuss her attitude took the cake.  At that point we notified the new waitress that we couldn't feel comfortable eating there at that point, although she did seem very nice, our original waitress ruined any chance of that happening.  Sad, because this was our absolute favorite restaurant to eat at up until this point.  My husband is 100% Irish and he felt that this place was well up to par on food, but disgustingly terrible for the service.  A pub is a place that you feel like home, where you have great food and service.  Today, McMullan's did not live up to their name unfortunately.

We happened on this place for dinner and man were we pleasantly surprised! The waitress was very attentive and knowledgeable. The food is authentic and truly amazing. I wish I could eat here everyday! The fish and chips were delicious and the fish was so fresh, not farm raised. I ate the corned beef cabbage entree which was served with some homemade brown bread. It was better than any corned beef dish I have ever had and they get their flour for their homemade brown bread from England. What topped the night were the TVs they had to watch the Seahawk's game. What a great place!

The veggie burger at McMullan's is deserving of an update: it is delicious. It may not be fancy, but it is firm (nothing worse than a mushy veggie burger), and it manages to have a nice grilled flavor so often missing in a meatless number. For those keeping count, it is $9. To make it even better, Mr. McMullan knows how to serve up a burger - with leafy green lettuce, a heaping of pickles and grilled onions! Love it! Also of note is the cole slaw. If you like it sweet, this is a gem of cabbage. I cleaned my plate and was a little sad to see it all go. Plus, they have free Wi-Fi, which makes my iPhone very happy.

The best Irish Pub in town! Good beer selection, nice atmosphere, and friendly staff.! 
The menu is awesome and authentic with the best Potato Cheese soup on the planet.! The soup (bowl) in combination with the appetizer Fish and Chips makes for a great and filling lunch. Don't forget a pint of Guinness..!! I always make a point to take out of town friends here for lunch.!

Ok.
I know I said we wouldn't be back after the St Patrick's day debacle 2 years ago.

Since that review, we have been back several times, and everything was back to normal.

Service has been stellar.  The quality of the food, out of this world.
I maintain that the best fish and chips in Vegas is right here.

Not to mention the fact that McMullens hosts St. Baldricks every year, a fundraiser for Children's Cancer Research.   

McMullens, I'm sorry I doubted you.  I just can't quit you.

An organization I'm a member of held an event in their back room. I really liked the set up we had back there - plenty of room (seems 100 or so could fit?), our own bar, and tasty bar food was brought out pretty regularly. Definitely a place I'd keep in mind if I was hosting events - or just looking for an "authentic" Irish pub off the strip to visit.
And authentic Irish pub off the strip... Great service great prices and a blast to have dinner and drinks with coworkers. I would highly suggest the small Uber ride to this Irish pub for dinner!

I was very surprised by the place!!

We went to McMullans after finding nothing worthwhile inside the Orleans Hotel for dinner.  I assumed it would just be typical pub food, but once we started looking at the menu, we had a hard time deciding what to order. Every item on the menu sounded delicious. I eventually settled on the Grand Irish Rueben which was indeed delicious, and the red onion relish that came on it really help set itself apart from typical Rueben sandwiches. 

This most impressive thing about this place is what my buddy ordered. He got the Irish Monster Burger, which is a one pound Ground Top Sirloin burger with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, bacon, onion rings, and 1000 Island Dressing. It also comes on an abnormally large sized bun. I challenged my buddy to eat the whole thing and surprisingly he did. 

This is truly one of the better Irish Pubs I have been to and will definitely come back next time I am in town.

We had a big group reservation and were put in our own room. Our server, Chris, was quick with water & drink orders as we all trickled in and was awesome about splitting the bill for each family. The Bits of Fish was very good and plenty of food for my lunch! Batter was light and not greasy. Fries on point. The Texas BBQ Burger was a very tasty char burger. Easy to get to, cool bar scene, music some nights. I'd go back!
Great place to come for drinks and apps with friends!I love the Irish Nachos!

I was invited to eat here by a cute boy that I had met that same night. The irish nachos were tasty, the ambience was chill, as it was super late in the evening, the company amazing. Five starts, no question.

We came here on no-meat Friday and the parking lot was packed even for early dinner. This is located next to The Orleans. From outside, it looks like your old plain ordinary bar but when you get to the dining area, it's cozy. It's like being at your Irish grandma's home - yup, I'm making that up...I obviously don't have an Irish grandma. The seats are plush.

They have Guinness, Smithwick's, Kilkenny, Harp...and imports such as Chimay, Crabbie's Ginger Beer and Wells Banana Bread Beer. Yum!

All of us ordered the fish and chips. It was sooo good. One of the best I've had ever. Huge portions too. The batter is perfectly light and crisp. The fries weren't seasoned so, season away. The fish and the fries weren't greasy and gross. 

We also ordered the sticky toffee pudding but I didn't get to try it - I'd have to come back after lent.

I ended up coming here to see the Georgia Bulldogs play while we were in Vegas. The place is pretty nice as your typical Irish bar, but I've noticed a lack of windows in the establishment. The decor was pretty nice a lot of Irish flags from various counties.

If you're a bulldog stand this is a place to be to watch a Georgia game they actually have their own room where you can actually hear the game. Their portions are rather large, although their service is a little slow. 

I tasted their Irish nachos (potato chips instead of corn chips), which were very good and plentiful. I also ordered the Scotch eggs. This was my first time trying this. It is a hard boiled egg that has been rolled with sausage and various Meats breaded and deep-fried. It was very flavorful and quite substantial, I would definitely order it again.

I also had the best Irish coffee I've ever had it was served on a glass goblet, with this delicious cream and powdered with some cinnamon in the shape of a shamrock, it was a beautiful sight to see.

Usually I'm not impressed by Irish bars but I definitely was impressed by this one. I enjoyed their food and atmosphere it was definitely a really fun place to hang out and watch a game.

The decor is really great.  There are quite a few different places to sit: they have a bar, tables with stools, a few booths that have really private alcoves, and then different seating areas with bench type seats and regular chairs for groups.  There is also some outdoor seating, and they are prepared for the winter chills with upright heaters.  They have live music pretty regularly.  There is... or was, not sure, a one-man band called Finnegan's Wake.  The last band I saw did some pretty cool Van Morrison and Flogging Molly covers.

I know it's blasphemy not to drink at Irish pub, but I don't drink at all, so I can't really rate the drinks.  I've heard from friends that the Guinness on tap is good, and that the Irish Coffee was ok.  They have these "Bit o' Beers" which run about $5 and have a sampler of... I think it was 5 beers.  There are 3 kinds, but the beers listed are all you can get, as in you can't substitute anything.  They have similar offerings for whiskey, and there is always a beer on special for a $4 pint.

I like to start with the chips.  They are homemade, and come with two different sauces.  The rosemary is my favorite, but the curry isn't bad, either.  They have Irish nachos, but it's basically just nachos with potato chips instead of tortilla chips.  Ground beef, cheese and potato are Irish staples which could be had in better ways.

In the winter, my favorite dish is the Beef and Guinness Stew.  Unfortunately, it is seasonal, so it's not currently being offered.  It's a saucy stew, obviously, and has tender vegetables, and of course, of course, potato.

If you aren't sure of what to get, they have a dinner entree called "Aon, Do, Tri," which, if you say it out loud, is "One, Two, Three," with an Irish accent.  That is a sampler with Corned Beef and Cabbage, Diddy's Irish Stew, and Shepherd's Pie.  Quite good with the exception of the Irish Stew, which I found to be a bit bland.  

I enjoy the fish and chips (make sure you ask for the Heinz Malt Vinegar on the side."  Crispy fish and crispy french fries.  I've been meaning to try the Reuben, but it comes with an onion relish or something like that, and you know how I feel about onions.

My friend had a slice of chocolate cake for dessert on her birthday, and that was rich, decadent, and delicious.  

The reason it doesn't get a 5/5 is because of the service.  The servers are nice and orders come out correctly, but sometimes it can be insanely slow.  I've been on nights where it wasn't so crowded, and I've been on nights where, walking through the crowd, I couldn't tell if it was really that packed or I was getting groped.  Although it doesn't happen every time, there are occasions, regardless of crowd, where a meal has taken an insanely long time.  I don't mind because I go with friends and we have no problems chit chatting, but if I was in a hurry, or less easy going, it'd be frustrating.  My last experience, I made a reservation at least a week prior for 7:00 for a birthday party, and came to find out when we arrived one of our tables had been given away.  We didn't actually get seated until 8:00 (they put us outside to sit and wait where it was pretty hot.  Who I assume is the owner came out and apologized, but nothing was really done to compensate), the appetizers we ordered didn't get there until almost 9:00, and the food took forever to come out once it was ordered.  I will assume it's because it was packed and a Friday night, but jeez, the wait was really something else.  I will continue to go here when the Irish food craving bites me, but I'll make sure not to go on a Friday night.  I shudder to think about the wait times on St. Patty's Day.

Simplicity is the way to go with McMullan's. A few friends and I stooped by for their happy hour since they are one of the few that offer one on a Sunday. Without further delay I will announce that their happy hour is 7 days a week from 3-6. 

The savings are not on the drink since our beers averaged six dollars a piece, but the appetizers are half off. Even though the list was short, the fish and chips bites ($4) were nice. The batter on fish was light in texture and color. Instead of over burning them, it came out crisp and I did not have to dab each piece with a napkin. We had also ordered the sausage rolls ($4) since that is a safe bet for those who have an allergy to soy. The rest of their food is deep fried in a vegetable oil, so avoid if you cannot tolerate soy. The rolls were so good that we ordered a second helping. An order of sliders ($12) were also a hit. The sirloin with grill onions and mushrooms topped with BBQ were so tender. The reuben was also delicious. The piles of meat made the three mini burgers overwhelming. With a huge helping of fries, no wonder my friend was stopped dead in his tracks. The Blackthorn and Magner Ciders were a nice refreshing way to end our night. The bill came out to $57 with a total of six beers, three happy hour appetizers, and the sliders.

On Sundays at 6:30, they have live music. The audience is given a list of songs that they can request.

The first time I was in this bar, was the night I unexpectedly fell in love with my husband. So this place holds a special place in my heart.
Good size bar but the place can get packed. There's an outside patio to get some fresh air out of the noise. The staff is fun, the crowd is diverse and a blast. There are usually bands playing on the weekends, it gets loud with everyone singing along, so don't expect to hold a meaningful conversation with someone. They have a fine selection of beer and whiskey at great prices. I've eaten a few things from their menu but the thing we keep going back to is the Irish Nachos, crispy, fresh potato chips covered with tons of melted gooey cheese, bacon, green onions, tomatoes, and sour cream. The half order is huge, more than enough for the 2 of us.
You can't help but have a good time here, whether your stopping in for a quick drink or planning on parking yourself bar side for the night.
"Thirst is a shameless disease so here's to a shameful cure."

It 's been quite a we've warmed the stools at McMullan's.  Having been home for 2 weeks from our Irish holiday, we were missing the Irish pubs and craic.  So Saturday we dropped in for some victuals and pints.  No visit to McMullan's during happy hour is complete without an order of their mountainous Irish Nachos, which is a spectacle borderlining on obscene due to the monstrous size.  We also ordered the Ann's Blackened Chicken Salad, with a side of rashers.  Seriously, I didn't  think it was possible, but I love this place even more!!!  They have rasher's, which is Irish bacon, which is the best way to eat pork.  And the rashers tasted just as good as the did when we were in Ireland.

Awesome night out off the strip with a fun local crowd and great music from John Windsor a real, live, fun and funny actual entertainer who loves the crowd.  Our server was lovely, really enjoyed the accent ;-p  Only qualm was after being seated it took quite some time before drink orders were actually taken, felt a bit forgotten in the cozy booth/room ;-p

This is probably my favorite bar in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is amazing, the food is delicious, and the drinks and cold. I recommend the Irish Nachos. The small easily feeds 2 people. On the weekend they have live music. Don't be surprised if it's busy and the wait staff is running around like crazy. That's just a typical day.

My husband and I agreed we needed something new, it had been a while for Irish. 

First thing I wanted to try the beer, so I got 'bits of beer' #3, Guinness, Kikenny cream ale, Murphy's Irish Stout, Boddingtons cream ale, and Smithwicks Irish ale. They were all good, some strong and some very light, loved them all!

We got two apps to go with the bits of beer, the Irish sausage rolls and McMullan's Irish nachos. The sausage rolls had sausage stuffed in puff pastry and came with a mustard dipping sauce, they were crispy like a egg roll. The nachoes were not expected, a tower of potato chips smothered in cheese, bacon, onions, tomatoes, chives and sour cream! Like a baked potato but made with chips, very good and very big order, both apps could have been shared by four or more!

For entree's, he got the Irish pie and I got Nanny Mac's Shepherds pie! Both were rich and delicious, filling and warmed my heart! 
Carrots, sweet peas and ground beef in a savory broth covered with mashed! Served with brown bread! Yummy.

We still had room for dessert and had to try the sticky toffee pudding with scoop of ice cream! Very good food, exceptional  service and great beer!

Delicious food and the most patient waiters/waitresses, ever. 
My grandpa is from Ireland, and loves to come here to eat the Sunday Roast and listen to the live music. He also likes to joke with the waitresses about the authenticity of the restaurant, and how accurate it is to his hometown. Usually, it's pretty close! 
I usually get the fish and chips, which is always amazing and I usually end up taking some home for lunch the next day. The atmosphere is great and if you have time I definitely recommend getting anything off the dessert menu!

1st Fridays we go to McMullins for Oysters. Yesterday, as usual we met another couple for Happy Hour.  The server "Jennifer" sucked.  Bad attitude. We asked for separate checks, ordered and was over charged for items. She never cleared our table. Only when we got up to get rid of the plates that had been sitting for 30 minutes did the bus person take them away.  When we got the bill. It was one check not split as requested when we sat down.  The server denied we had asked.  More attitude.
What troubles me as much is everyone else still wanted to give her a 18% tip.  Why?  For crap service?   We support the establishment by spending our hard earned money.  This server should be fired not getting a $20.00 tip for attitude and crappy service.

Blackened Chicken Irish Nachos.  They're so delicious that I want to write an ode to them.  I'm sure the rest of the food here is delicious, too, but I'll probably never know.   Nachos made with homemade potato chips?  Brilliant.  

I wish I could give this place ten billion stars.  It's got everything going for it.  An Irish pub that's open 24 hours a day and serves the tastiest nachos to ever pass through my lips?!?!  With video poker at the bar?  It can't get any better, right?  

Wrong.  It can.  It's also a NY Jets bar.  I love that more than I love the nachos.  

I'm packing up my car and moving to Las Vegas.

We really like McMullan's! It's nice that they have a separate smoking area with it's own bar away from the dining establishment. They often have good live bands playing and we've had dinner there once which if memory serves me correctly was pretty good. I think Thursdays are all you can eat fish & chips? A fun, often busy, pleasant little Irish pub that we've had many a good time at!

My favorite go to spot for gathering with friends. Great food, great service, and great entertainment. Tuesday night trivia is always a blast. Love the one man band on weekends. It's fun hearing the dirty limericks between his songs. Go, grab a pint, some Shepard's pie, and just relax in the homey atmosphere.

Great food, and excellent customer service! We were greeted right away, and our drinks were brought out within a few minutes. We placed our food order and got it within 20min. Hot and fresh. Likewise, the wait staff checks in periodically but not to the point of being annoying. Our glasses stayed full! The atmosphere is everything you'd hope from a traditional Irish pub - wood accents, deep colors, cozy decor, and hand carved mantles. I love this place. Highly recommended!
Excellent food, good happy hour prices. Fish & chips and corned beef both good enough to come back for.

The drink selection here is great with an amazing Irish whiskey catalogue. The food, however is sub standard. The nachos were cold when I got them, and I doubt piping hot nachos would've tasted a lot better. Fish and chips were decent and the bartenders had little to no personality.

I've been to several Irish pubs in my time and McMullan's is hands down the better ones I've been at. The bartenders are attentive and always have a friendly attitude. Beer - Carlsberg  Irish  Nachos with corn beef was amazing! I always look forward coming to this Irish gem!!!

Edit 2: After the pleasant experience with the management I wanted to give an additional 2 stars since a lot places don't pay attention to reviews let alone go ahead and apologize and explain their procedures. I can't wait to try the food!
Edit: After having contact with the business it appears the entertainment usually starts later on Sundays. Because it was st. Patrick's days entertainment was pretty much all day. Lesson learned here is on holidays call the establishment to confirm any changes to the usual. I definitely will be going back though probably not on a holiday haha!


**Warning**
Review based on service. Never was able to try food. I walked away.

It's saint Patrick's day so I was excited for some Irish food. I figure we'll do an early dinner since later in the night they have live bands and will probably be super packed. 
We show up and it is super packed 2 hours before the live bands are scheduled to perform. Well turns out the info they had was wrong and so they wanted $20 L.E.T. tax per person. Yeah I don't think I am going to pay $20 per person just so I can sit down and pay another 60-100 for food and drinks with probably slow service because of the amount of people there.

I know why they charged it too so people don't go early to avoid fee and wait for the band to come on but man 2 hours so early. I just wanted me some good Irish pub food! I was gonna be outta of the place in like an hour if food was prepared fast.

Maybe in the future I will go back to try the food and drinks but not any time soon.

Across the street from the Orleans, McMullan's is an Irish pub that pivots around a corner so that there's a dedicated space for smokers and video poker players, as well as a non-smoking bar and dining room.

Service was friendly (the kid didn't stop smiling the whole time we were there), just attentive enough and the atmosphere is a welcome respite from the brutal desert sun - dark, welcoming, cozy.

I ordered Ann's Blackened Chicken Salad, which was boldly flavorful, topped with crispy onion straws and vegetables like red peppers and corn in addition to more traditional salad accoutrements. The Creole mustard dressing was superb.

Definitely want to go back here again, the menu seems a lot more tempting than your usual video poker pub.

This is the best Irish pub in Las Vegas, and I specifically went looking for one I felt was worthy of describing as such. It beat out the Nine Fine Irishmen in the New York New York, as well as Rí Rá in the Mandalay Bay for the title.
We came over after a movie at the Orleans on a lark, and could not have been happier. They had food and beer specials, and we got there just in time for happy hour, when pints (real 20-ounce Imperial Pints, not 16-ounce American ones) are a dollar off, and most of the appetizers are half-price as well.
We started with the Irish Nachos, which other reviewers have gone on about for good reason! Layers of crisps and cheese and bacon with a dollop of sour cream the size of Texas on it. And that's just the "mini" size. We also had their brilliant chips & gravy with their fantastic onion gravy--inexpensive, simple and delicious.
The main course included show-stealing portions of their chicken and curry pie, and the best Reuben sandwich in living memory. We hadn't the room for dessert, but  returned for another visit to try the toffee pudding. I also tried the Irish Breakfast on our second visit, and the black and white pudding coupled with real rashers of Irish bacon and the best banger I had in a long time sold and resold me on making this not only my #1 Irish Pub pick, but my favorite restaurant in all of Sin City.
The décor is excellently authentic, down to pictures of regulars in the wall and a map of the Emerald Isle on the ceiling. Banquet rooms offer seating for large parties and interior partitions give a good but of separation between smaller tables. The service was also superb every time we came in; the bartenders were personable, the wait staff was friendly and made sure we always had a fresh pint when we needed one, and we never wanted for attention yet didn't feel smothered.
We unfortunately never made it in when they had live music, but the fact that they're already the best Irish pub we could find in town coupled with featuring live Irish music just makes them better.
Come in here and enjoy the craic. As soon as I come back through Las Vegas, I'm going to.

Solid place with lots of seating, good bar food, and a decent wine list (surprisingly!) We had a glass of cabernet and sparkling wine with fries. fairly girly fare for the place but they delivered! It was a quiet catch-up for me and my friend and the place saved a walk into the new orleans

I had a great shepherd's pie and a whisky tasting. I went with a group of people and everyone had a lot of fun. I definitely recommend this place if you start getting tired of the tourist traps on the strip.

I have been coming here for 6 years and have always had an amazing experience.  The bartenders are always friendly - and in the dinning room, Jen is an absolute amazing person to have serve you.   Also, way cheaper for quality drinks right next to the strip.

The closest thing to the Emerald Isle in Nevada or California! Great Irish favs and best Irish coffee too! I have a McCraig card that gets $10 off every $100 spent. So that's a bonus. If you make it down here, and you should, ask for Cassidi. (I got the spelling from my bill.) She's a sweety!
Love the chicken with mushrooms and much potatoes buy cannot stand smoking people and noise

Good breakfast -- poached eggs with homemade corned beef hash, along with a super spicy Bloody Mary.  Breakfast BLT good too. Friendly staff. Don't know about the night scene here, but def a better 24 hr option than the Denny's around the corner.
Bartender Mary cannot be topped, and the mussels are top notch. What a great pub! Recommend highly!

Called the day before Thanksgiving to see if it would be open Thanksgiving Day. I was told "yes, of course." Arrived 11am Thanksgiving day to find the pub closed -- though a sign on the building says open 365x24x7. Update: the owner messaged me to say they were open. Sorry, at 11am the doors were locked. Parking lot empty. I think the owner needs to investigate what his staff told him. THE DOORS WERE LOCKED.

Before I even start my review - I have to say that when I go to an Irish pub I do not get the cred I deserve.  I am half Irish Damn it!  I may not look it - but it's true... 

So, I go here with a friend and she tells me that a lot of "industry" people go there.  Basically, she was saying it should be a lively crowd.  When I hear "industry " people I am think hot ladies!  ... hey, a boy can dream ... right?

It was a friday and they had a band there doing mostly songs from the eighties so I was cool with that.  It was a pretty good crowd.  The bar is split into a smoking section and non - smoking section.  

I like it in there.  It obviously is not an authentic Irish pub being that we are in Las Vegas, but I think it has a nice appeal without trying to hard.  This is a cool place to hang out and chill with a few friends or have a big group and get a little rowdy.  

We had an order of Irish nachos.  I am from Idaho - we call them "Idaho Nachos" up there... but it's cool.  They were actually really good.  The potato chips were good enough just to eat on their own,  The half order is huge!

I am not into Guiness or black and tans  - so I had a few Newcastles.  

All in all - I really like this place.  Good place for locals and tourists.
A great stop for St. Patrick's day, to watch Australian Rugby or any day for a pint.. generally regarded better than Brendan's pub at the Orleans but you be the judge.

Fun place to hang out.  The server was bubbly and super friendly. The food was plentiful and tasty. The decor is what you would expect from an Irish pub.  The live music was an added bonus.  Have a good time at this place, we did.

1/7/16- Bartender: "You don't have a $10 off on your card." 
Me: *shows him the postcard I got in the mail.*
Bartender: "Your McCraic card is not working. You should write to our owner and get a new card."
I never did. 
I did however, return in the summertime, and came to find that my card, did indeed, work. 
Same card. Hmm. That's strange. 

Why didn't the bartender tell me there was a to go charge? 
He charged my card without even telling me that there was a to go charge. 
I was eating it there but wanted it in a to go box. 
I had already paid though, so there was nothing he could do. 

1/22/18-
Bartender: "
Me: "...?"
Bartender: *walks away quick enough for me to not even be able to ask what he meant. 
He goes to the smoking session and does stuff on the computer. He eventually brings us menus*
Server lady: *Does nothing. Stares at us.*

O..Kay? 
I walked out. 

---
I've been coming to McMullans since 2010. 
It hasn't been the same in a long time. A very long time. 

I've been getting the $10 off your meal special for four years now, and elected not to use it for 2016 and 2017 because in 2015, a bartender lied to me and told me that my McCraic card was not working. 
He refused to give me my discount. 

I thought tonight would be different, so I made my way there after work to enjoy some delicious Irish nachos. 
Nope. 

---
3/15/18
Come in for a bite and a drink since I'm stuck in the area, and the waiter seems hesitant to serve me, as if I'm poor or something. 
Ask him about pulling up my membership, and tell him about my situation with my McCraic card "never working" here. 
He brings me a new address for the card form, but doesn't acknowledge me or it for forty minutes, instead talks to this couple next to me. 
The only time he acknowledged me was to take my order, ask if I wanted anything other than my drink, and then to close my tab. 

The heavyset bartender ignored me the entire hour I was here, but after seeing me talk to a waiter, 
He then asked me if I had a to go order (I wanted extra compliments to go with my meal) 
I had to tell him: lI had a waiter take care of it. 
This is the first time you've talked to me."

My original bartender then came to talk to me ten minutes later and I told him that I had a waiter take care of it. 

I can't believe how hard it is to be taken care of by the bartenders here. 

The waiter did never get a manager over to me.

I love this place! Especially at happy hour, when select appetizers are half price. The bar has a good selection of beers on tap, video poker, and you can SMOKE! Now I know that might turn some away, but if you can't handle smoke, you can eat in the dining room - no smoking there.

I have only ordered two things at McMullen's; the fish and chips and the Caesar salad. The fish and chips have got to be the best in Vegas, possibly the best in Nevada. Battered cod perfectly deep fried so the crust is light and crunchy, and the fish is cooked perfectly. McMullen's take on a Caesar salad is inventive; whole romaine lettuce leaves wrapped in mozzarella cheese, drizzled with a house made dressing and sprinkled with very garlicky croutons. It's a bit messy, enough for two, and quite delicious.

I don't know why Yelp lists McMullen's under the heading "breakfast and brunch," when most of the menu seems devoted more towards dinner. I check out the menu every time I go (even though I always order the same thing), and it's very eclectic. The meat pies look delicious, and I've promised myself that the next time we go, I'll try the curry.

The service is good, and the ambience is friendly. The dining room can get a bit noisy, but it's the happy noise of people having fun. However, if you don't minding waiting for one, there are a few tables tucked away in corners where the sound is muffled a bit.

Make sure you try the IPA Ranger beer that's on tap. It's a bit fruity but finishes with that bitter taste we all expect from a well-crafted beer. And it's ice cold out of the tap.

In fact, have one for me too! Whatever you do though, do NOT miss this gem of a pub!

Been here twice now! First pub I visited when I turned 21 (mostly because I was craving some Irish nachos). Happy hour is so worth it because you get a good amount of food for a very low price. The full-sized Irish nachos was monstrous and delicious. The gravy that came with the fries and gravy was delicious but not overly salty at all. The bits o fish (small appetizer size of fish and chips) were hot and crisp. Beers and ciders during happy hour are $1 off as well. (:

We went on a Friday and there was live music, the whole place was full, and everyone seemed to be in a jolly mood (is it the alcohol?). We were a little lost at first, waiting for a table to be cleared up, but that was handled promptly once we were noticed by a host.

McMullan's was a great first pub experience. Our waitress was friendly and funny as well and I can definitely see myself coming back here when late night hunger strikes!
I liked the atmosphere a lot.  The food was wonderful...ordered Bangers and Mash.  The portions were large.  The service was a little slow and they were not that busy.

It's 3:00pm and that means Happy Hour! On a recommendation we went to McMullan's Irish Pub across from the Orleans. We walk in, sit at the bar and guess what....no bartender...what's up with this??? Anyway, she did show up after a few minutes, but we moved to the smoking side of the bar (hubby still smokes - I quit 2 years ago). Had a great bartender named Dallas (who bought me birthday beer)! Guinness, Bud Light, Do Dheag Wings, Irish Nachos and Crab Cakes - the food is 5 stars plus!!!! But the very best was dessert. Sticky Toffee Pudding - with just a bit of Bailey's poured over it...TO DIE FOR!!!!! Try saying Sticky Toffee Pudding three times after a few beers....it came out Stiffy Tooffee Puding..... hahahahahaha

Service is decent enough.. depending who you get.

My coworkers have spoken highly of their Irish Nachos, however, it's just so-so to me :x. But still worth a try if you've never had.

They have happy hour specials between 3-6pm in the afternoon and 10pm-2am at night every day. Their menu will indicate *HH* for all the ones that apply to happy hour so you won't be surprised when the bill comes!

The lighting is dim so watch out if you're playing cards that need better lighting ;b. Otherwise, it's a pretty chill place to hang out with friends and just drink/eat.

Their website has a more extensive list of all their specials. Tons of them :)!
(http://www.mcmullansirishpub.com/menu_specials.shtml)

GRAVEYARD SPECIALS 
Everyday from 11pm 'til 7am
$1 off all 20oz Draught Pints 
2 for 1 Liquor Specials with Casino ID

This was my second time here and I honestly can't remember how the service was before so I'll treat this as a first time experience.

We arrived here around 7:00pm on a Saturday night and it was quite loud due to some kind of wedding celebration being held on the opposite side of the bar.  Anyways, after looking around and observing the environment, we were immediately greeted by one of the hosts and his enthusiasm and friendliness pretty much set the tone for the night.  He asked us where we wanted to sit and gave us two menus before we walked over to the bar.

After sitting down, we were, again, greeted immediately - this time by the bartender Chris.  I was already very pleased with the service after only being in here for less than 5 minutes.  Chris was very amicable and her Irish accent genuine.  She talked to us for a bit before giving us waters with a wedge of lemon.  The water tasted very mineral-like and it bothered me that it had a carbonated after-taste to it.  I didn't like this so I told her to change the water and she was very understanding and didn't make me feel bad.  After the water tasting like this again for the second time, she informed me that it must've been the tap they had been accessing that night.  Not a big deal, but this was the only "downside" to the experience.

Anyways, after glancing over the huge beer menu and even bigger food menu, we decided to order a Boddingtons, Smithwicks, and the Half Order of Irish Nachos with Corned Beef to share.

The nachos were insanely huge for two people but they were absolutely delicious -- generous amount of corned beef and other yummy toppings.  I loved the fact that they stayed authentic to Irish style cuisine and used crisps (potato chips) as the substitute for tortilla chips.  

We didn't end up finishing the nachos because they got hard after a while due to the cheese hardening.  I ordered a Moscow Mule afterwards and was surprised that they let you keep the Ginger Beer -- that was alcoholic at 4.8% ABV -- along with the Mule because it's a part of the cocktail.  No one's ever done this for me before, even with non alcoholic ginger beer, and I really appreciated it.

As we were about to finish our drinks and food, there was live music themed to an Irish vibe.  I left the guitar player a tip before we left.

The total was around $38.00 without tip and was very reasonable for the three drinks and delicious food ordered.  

I would definitely come back here again and also to partake in their famous Trivia Night every Tuesday at 8pm.  Stellar service and impressive menu.  Very authentic and McMullan's definitely adhered to their Irish roots! Sláinte!

Very delicious!! 

We came here for beers and a soccer game on tv. Even though it was during NBA finals, they changed the channel to the Sounders game!

They have several beers on tap, lot of good ones. We had the Belgium VooDoo IPA, the Killian's, the Red Speckled Hen, and Bodington's Cream Ale.

Then we ordered the dinner portion of the Shepherd's Pie, and it was amazing. Definitely one of the best shepherds pies I've ever had. If I'm ever in Vegas again, I will return here!

Our food was amazing..We came in time for Happy Hour and we're not disapointed. The food was delicious and the service was great..The owner goes to every table and checks in . We will definitely be back.

Was looking for a place to watch champions league soccer on a Wednesday afternoon.  The strip didn't have any worthy options so decided to give this place a try. Short uber from the strip. Came on a Wednesday for Chelsea vs Barca leg 2 and arrived at a pleasantly vibrant spot for the game. Today's beer special was $4 ranger ipa and they had a $8 bbq chicken sandwich special. The food was quite good and the atmosphere was just what I was looking for. Bartenders were very attentive. I wish I had tried this place on the weekend for EPL action but I will definitely be back in the future.

Awesome bar awesome drinks! I love the theme of the place. The mussels and fish and chips are a must try. 

Grave and Day bartender are the best!

Please do not come here if you are expecting edible food or attentive service of any kind. 

We ordered 1 shepherds pie and 1 corned beef & cabbage. The "food" we got was nothing but sad. The shepherds pie was fake mashed potatoes served over taco seasoned meat. The corned beef was flavorless slices of meat mixed in with runny watery potatoes, a carrot and some celery. The cabbage was boiled beyond recognition. That last dish was $15! All needed salt badly and all were served up in flimsy aluminum containers with prepackaged sporks to eat with (think jr high lunch gone bad). Wow. Just wow. 

So unacceptable and sad. The only saving grace was the band. 

We will not be returning here again. Being local and loving places off the strip, I know we can do better. Yuck.

Came here w the work crew.. They told me it was goood.. Got here and we had to wait a few minutes for our table to be ready for our large party. Once it was ready they took out drink orders right  away. As for food. I ordered the cesar chicken wrap.. Big mistake!  It was plain n boring.. Just a tortilla w lettuce n chicken piece w fries on the side.. Everyone ordered something else n looked goood. My friend had the  chicken curry pot pie n it tasted good.. I'm getting that next time.. Other than my order the food being plain the service n everything else was good. Our server was on top of our drink orders n brought us whatever we needed. Thks guys.. I will be back

I love this place and have been coming here for over ten years.  The Tuesday night trivia is fun and well-organized.  I think there are 8 rounds, including a music round, matching round, and picture round.  The questions are challenging and the pace of the event is well done... enough time to consult your team without being rushed.  The food here is also awesome!  I've had lots of different things over the years... the Irish Nachos are a must and I also love to get the corned beef and hash as a late night/early morning breakfast after a night out.  Even just their burgers and standard bar food are all great and I've never had something subpar here to eat.  I feel like most of the bartenders I see have been the same ones over the years I've been coming here, which is a positive sign to me of an establishment that is well run and takes pride in the way they conduct business.  They frequently have live music and special events.  Also a great place to watch rugby and sports of that nature... not my thing, but just thought I'd throw it in there.  I love McMullan's!

Great value for the lunch specials. Watched the Real Madrid game to a $8 lunch + $4 beer. Great service, nice atmosphere. Would definitely go back for some of their evening activities (trivia, live music, etc.). Food was pretty good, but not anything to rave about, which is why I gave this place 4 out of 5 stars.

I must eat here when im in town!!!

This place has amazing Irish food but the real reason I come here is for the Irish nachos I know it sounds odd. 

These nachos are transcending they use homemade potato chips "it sounds odd but believe me they rock" and they pile them high with great quality toppings but be ware the portion is HUGE enough for 2 to 3 people.

McMullan's changed my local life! 

I walked in here for the first time a month ago for Trivia Night, every review I've read said it was the best in town but since I didn't have my own team, I was hoping to find a group of cool people who would let me join theirs. 

The host immediately noticed my apprehension and was so sweet in approaching a table asking if they'd accept a lone person for the night. He brought me over, introduced me and I've been playing with them every since! (Not that I'm any good.) 

This is the kind of pub that everyone wishes they had in their lives. Just like MaClaren's on "How I Met Your Mother." The ambiance is so cozy and snug, the waitstaff knows all the locals and vice versa, it's just the perfect a weekly gathering place with dozens of little nooks and crannies, backrooms and cubby-holes to be as social (or not) as you'd like! 

Their nachos are astronomical, the Shepard's Pie was delicious and the beer selection is as broad as a pub's beer selection should be. My only complaint was their soda bread. It was very dry. It came with butter, but I think a dipping glaze would've been better suited to make it more palatable...but maybe that's what beer is for!  

Come early to snag a good parking spot and a table in the front room for Trivia on Tuesday nights. It starts at 8pm and usually wraps around 10:30pm with a Grand Prize bar tab of $100 and $50 for 2nd Place.  

I love that there is a separate room (and entrance) for the gaming bar where smoking is permitted. And while there is some smoke crossover from the bar staff's open window, it's generally not too bad (and I'm very sensitive to smoke!) 

The bar AND the kitchen are open 24/7!

Bomb.com! The food here is amazing and I love it. The shepherd's pie, Irish nachos, sticky toffee pudding, their bread. Mmmmm my mouth is watering just writing this. I enjoy the atmosphere as well. Check it out and enjoy. Maybe hit it on a live music night.

My dad stayed across the street at the Orleans and kept asking about this place. Finally I reluctantly agreed and we walked over to have some pre dinner drinks. I was pleasantly surprised. Of course it's not 100% authentic but for this town I think it did a pretty good job of trying. Had a couple of pints and listen to a good o'l Irish boy play some music. Very talented and he was hilarious too. Overall a good time just a bit pricey

We just moved to Las Vegas and needed a new Irish Pub/ Restaurant. The wife and I agree that this is our new family hangout when we decide not to cook. Atmosphere is welcoming and there's always a soccer/football match on. We recommend the stew or Nanny Mac's shepherd's pie.

Great pub with good food too.

Tuesday night is pub quiz night.  Several people from the office stop by almost weekly.

Fish and chips are delicious as is the shepherd's pie, steak and mushroom pie, and curry pie.  Service is good and attentive, though can be sluggish when they're busy.

As one of the other reviewers said it doesn't really have a quaint neighborhood pub feel to it but it's still a great place to hang out and have a pint with friends.

I have yet to explore this entire menu heaven and I haven't even scratched the surface of the drinks this place has to offer!

Walked in on a Monday night and sat at the bar. The bar top is separated by large pillars, so much like the rest of the space, you almost have your own private section when you sit there. The rest of the space is full of large tables, private rooms, and a stage. If I close my eyes and think really hard, I can imagine this place feeling so authentic. Full of life, love, energy, great friends. I've never been to Ireland, but when I close my eyes and imagine this place packed to the brim, it's what I picture being in a local pub there to feel like.

Their wine selection is impressive. I had a glass of Sauvignon Blanc, I know the blasphemy in an Irish pub of all places, and ordered the sliders. Corned Beef, BBQ steak and Fried Fish. Each one has it's own unique flavor and were super delicious. There is plenty more this place has to offer, so I'll be back for a pint and whatever live performance takes place on that stage.

I am visiting  the area near this restaurant for a customer meeting.  I am staying in the area without a car, so I needed to find a place to eat within walking distance of where I am staying.  I found this on yelp and decided to try it based on the high average rating.  Now I am wonder if the bar is different here, if this is a different place, or if I hit a bad night.

I started with the house salad,  Hard to mess up and it was OK.  I am uncertain how it was dressed as all the dressing was on the stuff on the bottom of the plate while the top was basically sans dressing.   My entree was the Steak and Mushroom Irish Pie.  The pie itself was fine, adequately seasoned, served very hot and tasty.  The mashed potatoes seemed to have come from a box; they had the unmistakable flavor and texture of rehydrated potato product, not something made from fresh potatoes.  The gravy tasted like it came from a can.  And the peas were unmistakably from the freezer.  What?  It is the season for fresh peas, the produce markets are filled with them  And there is no excuse for not using fresh potatoes.

The staff was great and friendly, but the food is a definite 'pass' for me.

I've been to my fair share of Irish pubs. So, you can say I have certain expectations. McMullans pretty much meets all of them and more. First off, prices are pretty cheap compared to other places. The staff is charismatic and extremely easy to talk to. Jason happens to be my favorite. When it comes to the food, I haven't had anything other than, the Irish nachos, and their wings. I will defiantly try the other food but, You MUST try the Irish nachos, especially with chicken (blacken). I love the atmosphere as well. Dim, relaxed, very tranquil to say the least. They also have live music! I want to say every weekend. Defiantly my regular bar and will forever be my St. Patrick's day bar. If you're in the area and in the mood for a drink. McMullans is where you should stop.

A fine Irish pub, McMullen's delivers on all fronts, taste, quality, quantity and service. Check out Thursdays for AYCE fish and chips. Happy hour is usually between 3-6pm and 11pm-2am. We had $4 pints of Innis and Gunn, a great light Scottish ale. The Irish nachos and fish and chips are the way to go! In the mornings, get the eggs and hash. It's really hard to go wrong here. Live music on the weekends is fun. The whiskey and scotch menu is decent. It's comparable to Ri Ra at Madalay Bay, except 24/7.

Oh My God YES!  

Best Irish Pub in Vegas!  

Food, specials everything awesome!
Good Irish food and good Guinness the fish and chips are good and so is a shepherd pie

Still love this place. I come here every week and felt my review needed an update. I still highly recommend the burgers and the nachos, but I also really like their salads and curry pie.

I came here for a first date and honestly it was a good choice. I can't take credit for it because I didn't choose it but I am glad he suggested it. We sat out in the patio area which has a nice view of the strip and you can people watch (well car watch). The bartender helped us out with drinks and food. My date ordered banana bread beer and let me just say it was pretty dayam good. I don't really care for beer and I'm a devoted Corona mujer but I ordered 3 of those suckers. We shared the Irish Poutine and Bits and Chips (Fish and chips) and both dishes were scrumptious. He ordered fries and gravy which was interesting. The homemade chips were crunchy and perfectly seasoned. Towards the middle of our date, we were waited on the red headed Scottish lady (I'm sorry I don't remember her name - 3 beers remember) but she was so funny. She got the heaters turned on for us cause I was freezing. The bar area was semi-packed so we stayed outside since it was just us. There was music out there and two tvs but they weren't on. They even have lights strung out which gave a nice ambiance to the patio. Overall great company, great food and drinks and great service.
